Sounds crazy to me. Who owns this company that I speak to?From: stephen@hotelwifi.com [mailto:stephen@hotelwifi.com] Sent: Wednesday, July 17, 2013 2:32 PMTo: S Sikka; Brandon GirouardCc: shelly@hotelwifi.com; accounting@hotelwifi.com; corey@hotelwifi.com; Christian AanderudSubject: RE: Email Revenue Reports - Milford PlazaThey are not a 3rd party, they manufactured the very device that you use for authenticating guests. The report email you receive is directly from the gateway, we tried to fix the problem like we normally do however this time we couldnt. So we opened up a ticket with RGNets to resolve and they told us they cant assist because the gateway has been out of support since 2011. However annual support from RGNets has been a major point of contention for us . We have sent the Milford numerous invoices explaining the importance of maintaining annual software on the RGNets gateway. We have been told numerous times that it would be resolved and never has. We explained that RGnets needs to troubleshoot issues like the one that just occurred and will not if support is not kept current. We would assist if we could however this is outside our realm of expertise. Thank you, Stephen J NicholsHotel Internet Servicest: 866.265.7575 ext. 709m: 727.453.1486f: 866.383.2888www.hotelwifi.comFrom: Brandon Girouard [mailto:bgirouard@highgate.com] Sent: Wednesday, July 17, 2013 1:14 PMTo: S Sikka; stephen@hotelwifi.comSubject: RE: Email Revenue Reports - Milford PlazaImportance: HighStephen,Given the circumstances of our continuing relationship with you company wide, its important that we visit the requirements needed for the property to get this issue resolved. Its often difficult to request this from financial leaders as things are pre-budgeted. I went to check on down APs in rooms 844, 649, 411 and found out from the Chf Engineer that the 8th floor and some other floors are currently being renovated. The Chf Engineer said there is a project to replace carpet, furniture and paint in every room in the hotel. He said the Painters had approached a few months ago asking if they could take the APs off the walls and he said "NO". He said its suspicious that APs going down is date coincident with painters and carpet layers starting work on, specifically, the 8th floor.
    Of note also is that the stairs from the Lobby to the lower ballroom was eliminated when the lobby was recently renovated and the lower ballroom and meeting rooms are no longer being used and are just being used for storage (there are still APs on the lower lobby floor).

The AP in room 831 was down. I tested it directly on the IDF switch an could not get it to come up. I tested the cable to the room and it was fine. It appears that the AP had some sort of power issue as it looks like it cause port 8 on the IDF switch to shut down its PoE power. I replaced the AP with a new one. The new MAC and SN is: 24:c9:a1:08:40:c0  201302003030

Ticket Created: Portal Page Adjustment
Property upgraded there bandwidth from 2500/250 Mbps to 500/500 Mbps. i changed it in the fusion. the IP address stayed the same
Here is the text file of the email conversation mentioned above:

James once of the staff member called and said when they connect to the AP-Cellar-Tuscan_Room they were not able to get an ip address. I looked into tie and  found that vlan 800 and 802 was not tagged on port 5 on switch 172.16.0.20. Once i tagged that port on both vlans i was able to see devices get an ip address now

Summary: WiFi and Beyond TV - Newberry Hotel
Details: Hello,  We installed the WiFi and Beyond TV systems for your hotel.  I’m writing to see how everything is going in those areas.  If you would like to send us any feedback, need help with anything, or have a suggestion on how we could better service you, please let me know.

Property is going to have an edge router. ALex G is configuring this, Looks the Node that went down last week is due to the issues on the Fusion so that needs to be corrected by updating the Fusion to latest build. The property should atleast have a back up router in order for property not to have a down time for 5 hours or so.

Summary: WiFi and Support Services - Hyatt Centric
Details:
Called and left a voicemail for Dir Engineer, Khoa (pronounced Kwah).  Also sent email below:
Hi Khoa, I’m touching base to see how everything is going with the WiFi and WiFi Support at your hotel.  When you have a moment could you please let me know? Kind regards, Peggy Patrick

Checked about 15 rooms. All rooms had issues in the IDF. The issues are:

- unplugged from patch panel
- WAP cables used for telephones

My recommendation is to install cameras in the IDF closets to see who's messing with the patch panels.

I called today and left a message for you. Sorry I missed you! We handle the WIFI system & support services for the hotel and I just wanted to check in and see how things are going with your support services. Is everything working to your satisfaction?

Any feedback would be great or if you can let us know if there is something I can help with.

Just for an interesting read, we recently did a full survey of guests and hoteliers that is chalk full of good bits of information. Here is the link for that - https://www.hotelwifi.com/gre-survey-wp/

Looking forward to hearing back from you.

Best,

Summary: Jakes Cafe AP @ Knickerbocker - Centrada Case 0802.0216
Details:
Hello Centrada/Fred/Michael,

Regarding that Jakes Café AP being down again.  This seems to be a recurring issue and the AP has been replaced.  It seems there may be an issue with the cabling and we might need a new cable run.

Please See Walter’s previous emails below.

Michael – can we have Fred dispatched to the property please?

Fred, the details are:
Goes to port 25 on the 10.60.30.12 switch port 25, SN CN48FP322F in the Sub Cellar Level MDF.  Model of AP that is offline right now is r710, MAC e8:1d:a8:35:11:50, SN 411703006462.  AP should be located near the Jakes café.

--
Thanks,

Mike Piercy
Hotel Internet Services
Network Operations Center
t: 866.265.7575 ext. 0

From: Walter Isbell
Sent: Wednesday, May 23, 2018 2:24 PM
To: 'Avraham Rackovsky' 
Cc: Brandon Girouard ; Justin Portillo ; Clay Wade 
Subject: RE: The Knickerbocker NYC Jake's WiFi
If I’m not mistaken, each time this has been worked on its been found that a cabling problem is what is causing it to be offline.
Also, recently this AP was replaced with a new one, and the periodic up and down happened before the AP was replaced as well, so it is not likely an AP issue.  If there is still a problem with it then it is very likely the cable run.
Walter Isbell
Director of Network Operations
CCNA Wireless, CCNA R&S
Hotel Internet Services
t: 866.265.7575 ext. 742

Summary: Response to how are we doing?
Details:
Aloha Shelly,
Thank you for your follow up. Our Director of IT, Fred, is on vacation, but I have copied our Director of F&B and Events, Gabrielle, as many of the service issues affect the areas under her purview.
We have thus far since the transition not received any significant feedback one way or the other in Rooms. However, we do regularly receive negative comments about our lack of coverage at Swell Pool & Bar. Additionally, as we begin to elevate our event spaces, the expectation will similarly increase and we’d like to be sure that we can deliver the service for our groups. 
Thank you again for reaching out. We look forward to your assistance in getting the entire property up to speed.
JOSEPH YAMAOKA, HOTEL MANAGER

Summary: STAFF devices couldn't connect to the Wi-Fi
Details: Cas Ticket# 7593865.  Nelson Operational manager called us and reported the none of the Staff devices are can connect to the HIS (Wi-Fi SSID for Staff devices) SSID. Asked Juan and he said the HIS SSID (VLAN10) doesn't get internet feed from us. The internet feed they getting from a PBX telephone system, what we doesn't have control on it. We took the Staff devices over and created a new VLAN 825 for the Staff devices. Didn't create fixed hosts, getting DHCP from the Network addresses. The HIS SSID in the Smart Zone has been associated to the VLAN825 instead of 10 and left the password and the tunneling the same as it was. The devices connectivity and online status has been verified with Nelson. Sent an email from the changes.
I updated all the docs including the network diagrams and Equipment lists due to the previous docs skimping on diagrams and photos. Upload floor plans also.

Summary: Ticket Created: Please add new AP
Details: Ticket Created: Please add new AP
SW-Cottage-J went down. I emailed the property to have someone check on this.

Hi Nelson, how are You?

As we talked on the phone, I sending email about the changes what we made to get your "Staff" devices up, online.

The staff devices iPhones and iPads are connected to HIS Wi-Fi SSID and that's hasn't been changed.

These devices use to connected and have internet through a PBX telephone system, which we don't have any control on, and we don't really know about it. Last night it went down some reason and that's why you didn't get internet access. When you tried to connect to the HIS Wi-Fi it was connected, but you got an error message says: "Internet may not available"

For resolve this issue, in the Fusion gateway we created a new network. Took over the "Staff" devices and providing internet through the Fusion Gateway, not from the PBX telephone system.

I asked you to check the Staff devices including the housekeeping devices and you said everything is working fine and those devices are online. At this point we can keep all changes as it is, no further action needed.

If you will receive issues some devices what you couldn't check before, please let us know and we will help you to make them online also.

Thank you very much, have a great day!

Best,

Csaba Orban
(866)265-7575 Ext: 731
Hotel Internet Services
www.hotelwifi.com

Details: Ticket Created: Update Nagios after ISP migration

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details: On 31 Oct 19 the ISP Feed for Park central was down and neither the Chf Maint or the IT for the property knew where the source of the ISP Feed was located. What I found was that the Windstream's ISP Feed comes in on P-to-P dishes on the roof of Park Central. The Dishes go to a rack in the "Penthouse" on the roof where there is a rack. There is a Cisco switch with two Gig ports. The right hand ports is the ISP Feed which goes on Cat5e cable to the IDF on the 34th Floor. On the 34th floor the ISP Feed plugs into port 19 on blade F. The reason the ISP Feed was down was that the 34th IDF Switch was down due to being plugged into a failed UPS. I moved the 34th IDF Switch off the dead UPS an onto a separate power stripe. (See photos attached)

Hi Arnaldo, how are You?

We have noticed the guest Wi-Fi is down at the property of

Studio Allston
1234 Soldiers Field Rd,
Boston , MA-02135

Tried to ping the ISP modem, but it was not successful. Called the ISP, and they said, need to verify the power on the Adtran ISP device.
Tried to call the hotel, but the phone call did not go through.

Please check the power on the Adtran switch in the MDF, and if we have power it might needs to be power cycled.

Please let us know if anything.

Thank You,

Have a great day!

Best,

Royal Lahaina Resort SW-IDF-6-02 was showing down. I telnet into the switch and ping 172.16.0.1. Went into Nagios and forced check it and now the switches shows up

Summary: Century Link Fiber ISP link is down
Details:
Hi Maureen, how are you?

We've noticed the Century Link Fiber ISP feed is down at the property at

The Taj Boston
15 Arlington Street
Boston , MA   02116
617-536-5700.

As we know we don't have power outage, because the Guest Wi-Fi is still up on the Mega-Path backup ISP feed and the Guest Wi-Fi devices are accessible.

Called the ISP CenturyLink and  they said someone is reported the outage from the property already. They gave me the same ticket number what they already have: 22874141.

Maybe we can check on the Century Link devices if those are powered up or not, so we can determine what kind of outage is this.

We will keep monitoring the property and if we have more info, will let you know.

Thank You,

Have a great day!

Best,

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details: The fusion went down. Spoke to Cary at the property. he said the Fusion and the Zd are not getting any power. It turns out Both devices were connected to the web power switch but it was no configured. I had him plug the ZD into another power outlet and and both Fusions power supply into the unmanged ports on the WPS. once he did that the fusion and ZD came back up. I will create a ticket for Bill to configure it and put the devise back onto the WPS
The property's number in the general tab, (855) 865-6425 was not a direct number to the FD. I changed it to (212) 204-4980, a more direct line.

Summary: Park Central Hotel New York Switch in 11th Flr IDF 2 is Down
Details:
Opsgenie Alert#d8fa7f92-dfd2-4396-ae1c-22efd5da4e7e-1590901818713
Alert Priority: P2
Alert created at 2020-05-30 10:10:18
First note added on 2020-05-30 22:20:22 - 

2020-05-30 22:20:22 - I\'m on it - Drew
2020-05-30 22:41:37 - Alert Closed.

I was contacted by Martin Torres shortly after he spoke to Jordan. At the time the Fusion update issue was causing Node1 not to connect end users but they were getting internet access through node2. As mentioned by Jordan, that was worked out and currently all nodes and the cluster are functioning as intended; however Martin requested info as to what could be causing WiFi issues out there so I reiterated that the down Aps should be checked. I informed him and then emailed him a list of the APs down at the time: 2318, 1112, 1103, 1131, 2530, 2403, 1847, 19th Floor Elev, 1657 and 427. Note that the 2705 AP was also down but I was able to get that one working - it was going up/down due to the AP wired link negotiating to half duplex, that has caused issues at this location in the past.

Summary: WAN went down after a brief power outage
Details: WAN2 went down after a brief power interruption but ATT was having a hard time finding the account information. I was provided with a new circuit ID CIRCUIT ID - IZEC 543575 ATI and ticket number 269278511 under the name of  Pine Powell Partners LL. William (engineer) is working with MIS their remote support and they are about to reboot the modem. Will call him after

Angela from Centrada called and told me their tech is onsite and trying to add a "Printer-On" device to the Core-SW (172.16.0.10) port 16. She provided the MAC address 00:1b:eb:30:5e:45. Placed the MAC to the Guest Passthrough and their device got online.
LM for Lindsey, Hotel manager

The problem users are having logging in now is related to the room number that they enter.  The users must enter the room number exactly as it appears in the Fusion in order to login.  For example for room 0515 they cannot login with 515, they must enter 0515.
I have created a ticket with James on this.  Until James resolves their portal page will remain off.  Nathalie Uy at the property has been made aware that we are working on this.
Hi Natalie,  Just touching base to see how things are going with your Wifi and Wifi Support.  All is well?

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details:
The property cancelled their fiber line from Windstream.  All guest traffic was moved over to the Wiline feed.  The Wiline line was relabeled WAN 1 in Nagios and in the CRM.  Also, the Windstream line was removed from Nagios.  Here is the information that I am removing from the technical tab in the CRM regarding Windstream since this service was cancelled.
ISP: WindStream
Fiber
500x500Mbps
Repair#: 877.340.2555 opt. 2
Account#: 5700297
Circuit ID: 22/GEDO/753504/177/PUA/GED
Walter Isbell has been added as a 3rd party reference to this account so if you need to call for support identify yourself as Walter
This came into the network on port e1 of the core switch (10.60.30.10)

Windstream
IP: 40.135.239.174
Subnet Mask: 255.255.255.240
Gateway: 40.135.239.161
DNS 1: 4.2.2.1
DNS 2: 4.2.2.2

Hi Michael,

I called today and left a message for you. Sorry I missed you! We handle the WIFI system & support services for the hotel and I just wanted to check in and see how things are going with your support services. Is everything working to your satisfaction?

Any feedback would be great or if you can let us know if there is something I can help with.

Just for an interesting read, we recently did a full survey of guests and hoteliers that is chalk full of good bits of information. Here is the link for that - https://www.hotelwifi.com/gre-survey-wp/

Looking forward to hearing back from you.

Best,
Shelly Chandler
Customer Relations Manager
shelly@hotelwifi.com
www.hotelwifi.com
P: 866-265-7575 x737
F: 866-284-4911

[sig_logo.jpg]

Summary: CS email sent to Cory Larsen, IT Mangager.

Details: Talked with front desk lady and she says there are no issues with guests. Everything is fine right now. She there have been times when some guests get blocked out of the network when they try to connect with the Wifi. GM Avi Yesawich is in meetings all day.  She said he would have more up to date information.  Sent him an email to see how things are going.

Summary: Ticket Created: Please update monitoring and support
Details: Ticket Created: Please update monitoring and support

I upgrade the Zone Director and the ap's to the latest version 	9.13.3.0 build 22. this was done because the front desk called and said some of the staff and the guest are not able to get an ip address. I know upgrade the ZD to the latest  version or rebooting the ap's will fix the issue.

Hello Stephen,

I noticed we show the AP for room 1510 to be down and disconnected in the zone director, yet when I search the switch port it should be connected to there is now a different AP for room 1506 in its place. Can you verify for me whether or not there is still an AP for room 1510 being used or if the one in 1506 replaced it? I suspect so as the uptime for the AP in 1506 coincides with the downtime of the AP from 1510.

The mac address for the AP that we have listed as being in 1510 is 6C:AA:B3:30:BA:90.

Darren Bolstad
Network Support Technician
Hotel Internet Services

Summary: CCTV port addition needed, and add an unmanaged switch to the port.
Details:
Brian Slaughter from Centrada (ticket#612.0365) called they needed a port for CCTV camera system on a 3rd floor switch. CCTV VLAN 109. Port 28 configured on KNIC-3rdFL-IDF-SWITCH2 IP:10.60.30.15. They will add a 6 port unmanaged Netgear switch to have multiple cameras connected to it.
Pictures uploaded to the CRM docs.
Closing Ticket with file uploads

Replaced RXG with Fusion gateway. Room billing operational, performed some signal testing. Helped some guests get online. There problem was not due to coverage or hardware problems. Enabled 3 devices/billing.

We received a ticket from Intech (3rd party company) and stated no Wi-Fi near RM1560 and RM1564. I searched these APs were connected to the 172.17.2.16 switch. 
All switch ports that had an AP connected to it, were showing link. After running the #show CDP command on the 172.17.2.16 switch, I noticed multiple APs had default IPs, or their assigned DHCP fixed lease but were not responding to pings.
I instructed the tech on site to power cycle this switch. After preforming a power cycle, all access points came online.
The was a power outage that took down everything at the property. Phones were down as well. I called Centrada and informed them of the isue. Ticket#81681637

Hi,

We received an alert that there are multiple devices showing offline for this property. Here is the list of offline devices:

Royalton Park Avenue 16thfl_sw2.
Royalton Park Avenue 16thfl_sw1.
Royalton Park Avenue AP-2nd-Sales-Office.
Royalton Park Avenue AP-Fitness-Room.

Royalton Park Avenue AP-Room-1017.
Royalton Park Avenue AP-Restaurant-Back.
Royalton Park Avenue AP-Room-1010.

Can we have someone check on these devices and perhaps reboot them.

Let me know if you have questions.

Best Regards,

Chazz De Leon
Hotel Internet Services

Got an email from Arnaldo when sending support quote that the correct name is TDC Owner 1234 LLC. Updated the CRM.

On Apr 30, 2014, at 11:52 AM, walter@hotelwifi.com wrote:



Hi Brandon,

I've located the issue that was causing this problem.  It would appear that someone had moved a few cables around on the MDF PoE switch (IPECS is the manufacturer of the switch, model # ES-3026P, IP address 10.60.30.9).  There was an AP that was plugged into a port that was not configured for use on the guest network.  Since this AP was working correctly yesterday the only logical conclusion is that the port that this AP was plugged into has been changed.  Because of this all users connecting to this AP were not able to get to the Fusion and not able to get online.
I added the needed configuration for the port that this AP was moved to and users are now able to get online.  Users that were running into this problem were primarily connecting through the AP that I have already fixed but I still see a few more 169 addresses on the network so I'll need to run through the config on a few more switches to see if cables have been moved around anywhere else on the network.
At least twice in the past this has occurred and I've needed to correct it, and also as recently as last week a DHCP server was plugged into the ZoneDirector at the property which also caused an issue for a lot of guests.
If at all possible please track down why this is occurring so that we can avoid this happening in the future to avoid these issues for the guests and to avoid the hours of work that it adds for us.

Thanks,

Walter Isbell
Network Monitoring & Support Supervisor
CCNA, Network +, A+
Hotel Internet Services
t: 866.265.7575 ext. 742
www.hotelwifi.com

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Summary: Temp AP port assignements IDF Sw 34 - A blade
Details:
These are the temporary IDF Switch 34th floor A blade AP port assigments (these APs were originally on the B blade):
Port/AP Rm # = A5/AP-Rm-3409, A7/AP-Rm-3412, A11/AP-Rm-3420, A13/AP-Rm-3320, A15/AP-Rm-3421, A17/AP-Rm-3426, A19/AP-Rm-3501, A22/AP-Rm-3505, A24/AP-Rm-3506
APs in room 2430 and room 2530 had been removed and were missing. They were replaced with new 7055s. Two spare APs were also received and stored in the MDF.
If Centrada needs to know which PMS interface to restart for guest wifi, it is named "BIAS_YHT_WWW".
Closing Ticket with file uploads

Summary: Wifi & Beyond TV - IREP Newberry Hotel
Details: Hi Carlos, We’re your Wifi and Beyond TV provider for IREP Newberry Hotel.  I’m writing to see how things are going with the Wifi and Beyond TV.  Is everything running smoothly?
IPMI also needs to be added to nagios.

My suspicion is that the issue the guest ran into was a result of the "disable" function associated with the login button. This is designed to prevent duplicate charges caused by clicking the button multiple times. Since this location is free, I removed this feature as it serves no purpose and can very occasionally cause situations like this to occur. - Sean

All 6 DSLAMs went down. I called property multiple times trying to get a hold of someone. I finally got a hold of an IT staff member who helped me rebooting the DSLAMS, after he did all 6 of them came back up.

Summary: Ruckus Support Pricing for Hyatt Centric Arlington
Details:
Hello
(I am copying all of the contacts we have at the property because I want to make sure everyone is reached. Please update us on any contact changes and excuse our errors.)

UNTIL MARCH 26th, 2022, you can renew all back Ruckus Annual Support for the cost of ONE YEAR of support.
They are re-starting support.
That means, if you are expired 3 years, and you order tomorrow, your support will be good for one year from the date of purchase.
You don’t have to buy back support.
There is no reinstatement fee.

Also, as of APRIL 1ST,2022, the price of Ruckus Annual Support will be increasing 5-10%. If you sign off now, you can lock in the old rate.

This is what the Ruckus Annual Support covers:

1.            Advanced Hardware Replacement In the event of hardware failure, Premium Watchdog Support customers may receive a replacement Zone Director in advance of return shipment. All returns must be authorized and assigned RMA numbers in advance by a Hotel Internet Services Support member.
2.            Software Updates and Upgrades Bug fix and maintenance releases and accompanying documentation are available via Hotel Internet Services or the Ruckus Support Web site. Premium Watchdog Support customers will be provided with software upgrades for the applicable term of their software contract.
3.            Extended Warranty on Outdoor Access Points With the purchase of Premium Watchdog support or Advanced Hardware Replacement, all outdoor access points connected to your Zone Director will have its warranty extended to the life of the Zone Director instead of the usual 1-year warranty that came with the purchase of the outdoor access point

1/3/5 years are available on most equipment.

Ask us to send you an updated quote.

Please let us know if you have any questions.

Best regards.

Summary: Park Central Hotel San Francisco SW-IDF-22-01
Details:
Hello John,

I just wanted you to be aware that the HSIA ethernet switch on the 22nd floor has gone offline.

I have contacted engineering who is sending someone to check power / reboot, etc.

--
Thanks,

Mike Piercy
Hotel Internet Services
Network Operations Center
t: 866.265.7575 ext. 0

[http://hotelwifi.com/images/sig/email_footer_revised_01_02.png]

[http://hotelwifi.com/images/sig/email_footer_revised_01.png]

[http://hotelwifi.com/images/sig/email_footer_revised_02.png]

[http://hotelwifi.com/images/sig/email_footer_revised_03.png]

[http://hotelwifi.com/images/sig/email_footer_revised_04.png]

[http://hotelwifi.com/images/sig/email_footer_revised_connected.png]

Reassigning ticket to Charles.
Charles I believe that the switch port that the Fusion connects to is in the wrong VLAN on the admin network.  When I do a tcpdump on igb3 I am seeing traffic in the 10.2.98.0/24 network and not the 10.2.99.0/24 network that we are suppose to be in for communicating to the PMS server.  I believe Highgate uses the third octet to identify the VLAN on their switches, so the switch port that the Fusion connects to on their switch is in VLAN 98 currently, and it should be in VLAN 99.  The MAC address of the Fusion on igb3 is 0c:c4:7a:c5:62:67.  Centrada should be able to see this MAC address on their side when they search in their switches.
Get them to change the port we are connected to so that it is native in VLAN 99 and that should resolve the problem.  Centrada should be able to assist with this.

Summary: Ticket Created: Please update on Monitoring and Support
Details: Ticket Created: Please update on Monitoring and Support

I have turned the portal page off, the PMS system is currently offline. Jonathan from Centrada has given the okay with this and they will be working on getting the PMS system online. Ticket number 5932144
I decided to use VLAN 320 for the wired port. Port 43 on the switch with an IP address of 10.60.30.14 was configured to pass untagged traffic into VLAN 320.

Brian called in asking for assistance as a guest that has a conference scheduled in the Rincon room for 40 people said that the speeds were not sufficient. I restarted the one access point in the room and Brian will get it tested and call back if there are still issues. The guest that made the request was no longer there to do the testing with.
Closing Ticket with file uploads
I had to revert the changes back beacuase POS devices are already set with gateway 10.40.228.1. Manny wanted to set back the gateway to 10.40.228.1 IP conflict issue still persists.
Portal page created, VLAN, and SSID setup.
Down due to an overdue payment. Alex emailed Michael St-Laurent but haven’t heard back.

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details: Guests were getting "error code 36" when they tried to login. I spoke with Prentess who said we can turn the portal page off. I turned the portal page off.

Elvir Dervisevic informed us that the guests are having issues connecting to internet. Changed inactivity timeout on ZD from 5 minutes to 500 minutes. Also I have noticed Timekeeper AP has 99 devices associated to it and all the devices are connected to HotSOS1 SSID. Increased the limit of AP to allow clients on each radio to 150 and also changed the AP group system default to allow 150 clients. But the Timekeeper AP keep on refusing the client to join differnet SSID. Opened a ticket with Ruckus on this. They wanted me to create a ssid and broadcast on the AP without tunneling it. Emailed Elvir that we are still looking into it.
Send Support quotes via mail and email to Christian, Accounting and GM.
This was completed on 5/22/14.

Summary: Royalton Park Avenue: Customer Service notes 11/8/21 - 3/9/22
Details:
3/9/22 Called Jasmin Santos and reached her.  She said that she was confused and doesn't understand who's who but that Corporate directed her to contact Tower Stream, and ISP, and she has been working with Michael Savastano on this issue.  She said that I could close this escalation. I acknowledged her and told her I would do so, but that she could contact us if she needed any help with this going forward.  Then I wrote up a Red-tag and sent it in.                                                                                                                                                                                                                    3/3/22 Sent a note to Red tag team for an update on this Highgate escalation.                                                                                                                                                      2/2/22 Jasmin Santos,  Office Coordinator for IGC Hospitality.  She says they are having issues with connectivity on the rooftop (bar & restaurant, where the employees hang out). She asked if we could move AP's, perhaps higher, to correct the problem, and if there would be charges.  Also asked it we could send someone out to check all the APs and make sure everything is running smoothly.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
12/15/21 Heard back via email from Matthew Palumbo. He says he has concerns, that issues have been handled but continue to recur and that he will reach out to me when he's back in the office.  I told him I understood and I am here when he is ready.  Ran it by Shelly to ensure it's okay to wait to escalate.  She said yes.                                                                                                                                                                                                12/14/21 Called & spoke with Bill Mahalco and he is unaware of any issues.  I told him I would not escalate until/unless I heard back from them.  He will discuss with Matthew Palumbo tomorrow and let me know.  I then emailed Matthew back and told him same.                                                                                                                                            12/14/21 11:35 AM  Matthew Palumbo answered email immediately and said they are having issues.  He is out of office today but I responded and told him I would reach out to the terminal he cc'd on his email.                                                                                                                                         12/14/21 Called and left msg for Matthew Palumbo, Dir of Engineering and sent FU email.                                                                                        11/8/21 Note in CRM dated today for PO f/AP troubleshooting.  No call today - made note in CRM for 11/18 follow-up.

Chris from Megapath called and said that the circuit is up and he's logged into the modem and there is nothing plugged into it. Will tryt to get someone to plug Fusion into modem. 
From Mike's email: Yes, the backup AT&T modem needs to be connected to the back of the fusion in the port labeled em1.

Summary: Convention Device Added in Park Central Ballroom
Details:
Port fa 5/11 was setup on Park Central core switch in VLAN 44 for a convention that they are having in the Ballroom.  This device was provided the IP address 206.71.234.131.  VLAN 44 goes directly to the ISP device which comes off port 16 of the HP Core Switch (10.61.35.25) on the West House side.
Client confirmed that they were able to get online through this port.  The group will be adding their own router here.
I have been emailing the client trying to get more information on what she wants.
The portal was turned back on today.

RM 1510 AP is down in the ZD, but I went to the 15th and the 16th fl and checked all of the APs on the hallways. Every APs was up and running fine. It might be was wrong, somebody replaced that and forgot to remove from the ZD the old one. It was down since Fire 04/2016. 

"Lobby Back" AP location was unknown. I found it in the Fire Alarm Panel Closet between the Jake's bistro and the Lobby desks on the Lobby level. The AP is placed in the cutout on the ceiling inside the closet. Pictures uploaded in the DOCS.

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details: I got a call from a Centrada Tech Farrel, he said one of their clients had lost internet a couple days ago. He mentioned that this client had a Cisco router connected to port A19 on the Core Switch. I ssh into the Core Switch and I was able to see that the A19 port status was up/down. I had him connect his laptop to that port and as soon as he did, I was able to see the port status go to up/up. I asked him to check on the Cisco router's port configuration settings and send it to us so we can adjust that on our end. His email address is: fbluford@centrada.com

I found the portal to be turned off at this location. 
I got with Sean who said it's okay to turn back on - his work on it is complete. It's now back on. 
I tested the IE issue that I had previously made a ticket for him on and that problem is no longer occurring.

Checked the calls and verified that the issue was still occurring - guests would log in and get hung up on a page that says "please wait" instead of redirecting to the landing page.

James had a hunch that deleting and re-adding the Splash and Landing portals in the GUI would help. Did so as well as rebooted the Fusion. Checked for related CAS calls this morning and haven't seen any since then.

I restrted the PMS interface and that seem to fix it. I tested with a room (room 403 last name west) and was able to log in

Server will be  having a static IP of 192.168.220.2. This is broadcasted throughout the property. BSSID was already sent to Erin, project manager of panic device project.

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Summary: New Edge IT for Hyatt Reg SF
Details: Up until last week, Robert was the Edge IT for Highgate properties in San Francisco. However, Robert is now only over Stanford Court and Caza. This past week, Hyatt SF has had a temp IT, Ryan. Ryan will be turning over to a new IT specifically only over Hyatt Regency SF. Ryan will turn my contact info over to the new IT.

Spoke with Front Desk person.  Everything is good with the Wifi.  Updated CRM to reflect new GM, Annelle Kapp, who was off site today.  Sent Annelle an email: Hello Annelle, I called Circa 39 today to ask how everything is going with the Wifi and Wifi support.  I missed you since you’re off site today, but your Front Desk person told me that things are going well. Wanted to follow up to let you know I’d reached out, and we are here if you need anything.   It’s our goal to make sure you always receive excellent service. My contact information is below and I look forward to any feedback you might have! Kind regards,

Thanks very much for taking my call today. I appreciate you letting me know
about the issue with the bandwidth and also with the WIFI in room #432 being
a little spotty.  I have already sent this to our Support team, who will be happy to
help you get these issues resolved.  You should be hearing from someone soon.

As I mentioned, I will be following up with you to ensure you’re satisfied with the
results. Meanwhile, don’t hesitate to call me if I can help further.

Thanks again for your time and have a great rest of your week!

Kind regards,

Amy emailed at why WAN2 is down. See below

All, 

I just spoke to Spectrum. They are saying it is signaling issues and the plant maintence team is still working on the ticket. It is not he modem, but issues at the street. That ticket is still opened. 

They are resetting the modem and sending another ticket to the plant maintence team. 

I am opening a billing ticket to get a credit for the 7 days we have not had service. 

Two ticket numbers: 123506 (from end of last week) and (03854815 from today).

They said the ticket has a tech assigned so they assume the outside work should be completed today.

I will follow up tomorrow afternoon as I am in meetings until about 1 pm tomorrow.

Summary: Cable re Run for AP in room 2302 West House
Details:
The cable for this AP went bad.  We sent out a tech, Fred Chang (fred@everfinity.com) to re run this cable.  Here are his notes from the work after he completed it.
"Hi Walter,
We replaced the data cable for room 2302 WAP Yesterday.  The new cable was not able to be punched to the original patch panel port, which is labeled "23E". I terminated the cable, marked "2302", with male RJ45 plug and plugged it directly into port 7 of the switch, labeled 22-2. The WAP in room 2302 lit up with the new cable.
FYI, The original bad cable was over heated on top of a hallway light and the wire jackets were carbonized and caused the shortage.
Thanks,
Fred"

I spoke with Amy Moler from Ripplepoint and she scheduled a tech from the ISP to come look at their modem. 

A tech will be onsite Monday between 1-4 pm PST. I instructed them to call me before leaving. I will make sure I can ping the fusion IP – or should I try to get you to test connecting to the fusion?

Amy

FD calling in about problems with guests authenticating when whey log into the network. Michael from Centrata did a soft reboot to the server interface. Connection to the PMS server didn't come back up. Ping continues to show the line is down. Michael is going to try and get a Tech to look into the cable and see if it has been unplugged or damaged. The portal page has been turned off for now, and will contact us when they are ready to get it turned back on.

Cas skyped me saying they were unable to access the fusion but they were able to ping it. I had the same issue. I tried to ssh into the fusion but it wsa taking a long time. I was able to ssh into it I restarted the web server once i did that. i checked the health notices and the memory is over 90% utilization (28.88GB/32.00GB) but once the went server was restarted the the memory went back to 12gb

Email from Richard Luberes: Good Morning,  We connected the access points however Eric is stating that he does not configure the credentials?  Can someone please assist here? We have Tesla coming onsite today and we do not have it configured yet. SSID : Tesla1. Tesla2023!     Opened support ticket in Freshdesk.  https://hotelwifi.freshdesk.com/a/tickets/44038    Note: Eric is with Edge Communications.

Almost all APs went off line. Checked documentation and found that the DSLAMs have not been imported to Nagios. Fusion port forward for DSLAMs was on 443, so changed it to 80. Tried to access the DSLAMs, not able to. Called property to get them checked. Found, through alot of going around in circles, that the best person to contact is "Arban" (not sure of the spelling) so added him to the Contacts. He said he would go check the DSLAMs to see if they were unplugged. I then called Centrada and created a ticket to have one of their Techs check things out, as no call back from Arban and DSLAMs still down 30 min later. TIcket #0121.0248.

Arben called back and said the UPS was off, looked like it overloaded and turned off. Nothing was unplugged. He rebooted it and everything came back on line.

I’m trying to gather the latest IP info for Royalton Park Avenue.  It appears my notes are out of date (wrong).

The Backup WAN connection on the Fusion went down a few minutes ago.  98.0.133.58 with a gateway of 98.0.133.57.  It has since come up again.

I called Towerstream but they said they didn’t own/control that IP address.  They did tell me that they showed the Primary WAN connection on the Fusion 69.38.171.2 was up with its gateway of 68.38.171.1.

I thought I’d take the opportunity to request the correct circuit information along with Support phone numbers, account numbers, Link IDs, etc, for both circuits please.

Summary: CS Call: Spoke with Mark Cartagena, IT Tech, this afternoon.
Details:
He says he's been working with Walter and David recently, but that he can't get into the URL
now since the upgrade.  He tried to contact them but no response yet, and asked for help
getting an answer.  I sent an email to both Walter and David asking them to contact him to
help him with this.
Closing Ticket with file uploads

Oscar, the Food and Beverage Manager, uses an iPad to connect to an audio player for music in the lobby/bar. The audio player is currently connected via Ethernet to a Netgear router that we do not manage. 
After we last spoke he was able to connect his iPad to the SSID from the Netgear router and connect via an app to the audio device.

We have a similar SSID that they are currently not using for that device. Crestron_AP.  The SSID from the Netgear device is Crestron_AP1
The Netgear router goes into an 8 port Cisco switch in a closet on the lower lobby level. It appears their A/V company installed and manages that switch. 
The audio device is in the same closet with the Cisco switch. It does not appear that we have any of our networking equipment in that closet. 

This is the MAC for the audio device 00:10:7f:38:fe:e8

Hi Manny,

I noticed an IP conflict at Hotel Figueroa being caused by a Cisco Meraki device plugged into port 43 of our core switch.

Can you check if this switch is using the IP address 10.40.228.1?

The Fusion has this IP address as well.

Thanks,

Charles Badroos

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details: On 31 Oct 19 the ISP Feed for Park central was down and neither the Chf Maint or the IT for the property knew where the source of the ISP Feed was located. What I found was that the Windstream's ISP Feed comes in on P-to-P dishes on the roof of Park Central. The Dishes go to a rack in the "Penthouse" on the roof where there is a rack. There is a Cisco switch with two Gig ports. The right hand ports is the ISP Feed which goes on Cat5e cable to the IDF on the 34th Floor. On the 34th floor the ISP Feed plugs into port 19 on blade F. The reason the ISP Feed was down was that the 34th IDF Switch was down due to being plugged into a failed UPS. I moved the 34th IDF Switch off the dead UPS an onto a separate power stripe. (See photos attached)

Summary: Portal is turned on and Feature requests
Details:
Andrew from centrada called us these are the changes that were made 
Portal page is turned on. Created a new shared credential for the staff use. It has 200/200Mbps bandwidth. Access code is markeradmin. 

I told him the network is secure and it is isolated. They will see unsecure even the portal page is showing up just becuase they have Fusion as main device to handle portal page. It is completely secure. filters are already in place. 

He also requsted some changes to be made on portal page. He wants access code option to be first and room number and last name to be second. 

I will be calling him once the update is done.
Property was upgraded to a Fusion gateway - currently awaiting new equipment list as it is not active in Nagios.

From Juan regarding Raundy visit to property on June 19: "We didn’t find any particular issue at Michelangelo. We did signal testing and tested login through the portal page  without any issues. The Fusion was updated to 12.0 OS per Walter’s recommendation though. There is one more thing we did, we moved some connections around to get the actual ISP bandwidth. There was a 10/100 Mbps switch in the middle and we were only getting 100 Mbps instead of 500 Mbps. We had to bypass it."
Closing Ticket with file uploads
I sent another email to see if someone had checked on the Switch in the M Cottage, and the P2P in the T Cottage.
There are 0 down ap's. Jonathan Despues  was able to get them all online!!!!!

Summary: Wifi & Beyond TV - IREP Newbury Hotel
Details: Hello Carlos, I’m writing to check up and see how things are going with the Wifi and Beyond TV support that we provide for you at IREP Newbury Hotel. Is everything going well?  Is there anything you need from us to better service your guests Wifi and Beyond TV needs?

I tried calling Anil but I was unable to reach him. I tried calling FD and got transferred to IT office but nobody answered the phone. I sent an email to Anil asking if someone onsite is available to check on the Fusion.
The WAP was moved originally from 1934 to 1935. Yesterday it was moved to 1933.

The ap's below were down. I logged into each switch and turned off the POE and then Turned it back on once i did that the AP came back up

AP-Stairwell-3-A	
AP-Stairwell-3-B	
AP-Stairwell-5-A

Summary: Ticket Created: Packet Loss from ISP
Details: Ticket Created: Packet Loss from ISP

The Fusion was not responding to pings but its gateway was up. Both of the admin networks were down. The web power switch was not loading its GUI. I called the property. They were performing power tests.

Hi Khoa, how are you?

As we talked on the phone, I see only 3 APs down from the 115. Down APs in room 411, 1416 ( noted missing) and 1603.

I was able to log in to the portal page with one of the room's credential, but the PMS has an error - Can't connect to the sever.
I restarted the PMS on our side, but no change. It needs to be restarted from the admin side also, to have the connection back.

Please let us know if the issue is still exist.

Thank you.

Best,

Csaba Orban
(866)265-7575 Ext: 731
Hotel Internet Services

>>> Sent from my iPhone

The Fusion’s WAN2 interface and its gateway were not responding to pings. The Fusion’s WAN1 interface and its gateway were dropping several packets. I called the property. An engineer is waiting for an AT&T router to be sent to the property to bring WAN2 back up. I asked if he could reboot the WAN1 modem. It was rebooted.   	
A staff member called the NOC. He said that WAN2 was back up. The Fusion’s WAN2 IP address and its gateways were still not responding to pings. I asked the staff member to see if he could verify if the new AT&T router was using the same IP address it was before. He said that he would get more information and call us back. 
Someone from Centrada called. He conferenced in a few people to get the Wi-Fi back up at the property. Someone from AT&T informed us that port 2 on the AT&T router was supposed to be used to connect to the Fusion. This port was not connected to anything. The Fusion ‘s WAN2 interface was connected to port 7 on the core switch. The core switch did not seem to have empty ports. When the AT&T router was connected to port 3 on the core switch, the Fusion’s gateway came up but the Fusion was still down. They could not find out which port the old ISP device was connected to. I suggested that they connect the Fusion directly into the AT&T router. They did this and the Fusion came up.

Summary: Park Central Hotel New York - Multiple Devices Offline
Details:
Opsgenie Alert#339
Alert Priority: P3
Alert created at 2020-05-06 07:34:54
First note added on 2020-05-06 21:29:09 - 

2020-05-06 21:29:09 - I\'m checking on it - Drew
2020-05-06 21:30:52 - Attachment shows 8 APs down.\\nIn Nagios, only 6 APs are down.\\nI will keep monitoring this until APs recover.
2020-05-06 21:33:13 - only 2 APs remains down.
2020-05-06 21:33:17 - Alert Closed.

The Fusion could not connect to the PMS server. The PMS server was not responding to pings. I restarted the Fusion's PMS interface. The PMS server was still not responding to pings. I called the property and spoke with an engineer. I asked if he could check the connection between the Fusion and the property's PMS server. He said that he would not be able to do this. He said that Centrada deals with things like this. I called Centrada. Ticket 1270607052 was created. I was told that they would check it out.

Summary: Ticket Created: Property Upgrade - Nagios needs to be Updated
Details: Ticket Created: Property Upgrade - Nagios needs to be Updated

David contacted me to have Panic Button device MAC addresses added to the ZD's ACL which is used on the Panic Button SSID. They are replacing some of these so these need to be added to use the wifi.
I found that the ACL has the maximum number of MAC addresses that can be added already, so for now I've requested the MACs of the previous units so I can remove those and add the new ones.
This may not be info that the property has so I'll likey be changing the setup slightly here so a MAC group in the Fusion is used instead of the current L2 ACL.That way we can simply setup a MAC pattern for Panic Button devices and will not need to add anymore in the future.

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details: The AP in the Franciscan Meeting Room on the 3rd Floor is down due to a water leak. The center ceiling of the meeting room was severely flooded by a water pipe break. AP-FL03-Franciscan was right in the middle of the leak. Engineer Alan Purdue said that the AP was found sitting in a pool of water. One of the Engineers removed it and its somewhere on the floor covered by carpet that they have been pulling up. As soon as he can locate the AP I will try powering it up. I did test the cable that was still in the ceiling and it was working, so no damage occurred to the switch (2nd Floor IDF Switch).

Summary: CS call - spoke to Hamadi Sissoko, Operations Manager, who is taking over for Marco Gianni currently.  He says all is running smoothly. Also sent FU email (see below).
Details:
Dear Hamadi,
 
Thank you for taking the time to talk to me this afternoon. I’m so glad
to hear you are happy with the WIFI system and support services.
 
I wanted to let you know this is how you can contact me if you need to
or have any issues with the service in the future. Reach out anytime, I’m
here to help.
 
And you can reach your technical support contacts here, 866-265-7575, ext. 0.
 
I also wanted to let you know about our new product GuestCast, which has 
been getting a lot of interest.  After a survey of over 700 guests, we found that
65% of them wanted to cast their own content onto the TV.  Here is a link to the
information on our website in case you want to check it out:
https://vimeo.com/660731531
 
Thanks again for your time today.
 
Have a great weekend!
 
Best,
The Internet has been going down for days (Mar 8, 9,10, 11, 15)and recovers after manual reboot.
Bill Johnson is in the city and doing maintenance on all properties that pay for maintenance.  Closing ticket.

From: Debbie Dobbe <debbied@hotelwifi.com> 
Sent: Sunday, February 13, 2022 2:28 PM
To: Walter Isbell <walter@hotelwifi.com>; Billy Litsheim <billy@hotelwifi.com>; Patrick Martin <patrick@hotelwifi.com>; Stephen Nichols <stephen@hotelwifi.com>
Cc: Gary Patrick <gary@hotelwifi.com>; Steve Dobbe <steve@hotelwifi.com>; Shelly Chandler <shelly@hotelwifi.com>
Subject: CUSTOMER COMPLAINT: The Marker Key West 
Importance: High
 
Dear All –
 
I received an email from Andy Davidson today, in response to my conversation
with him yesterday.  He included the email chain related to the issues they are having
and asked that we read through it, and see what we can do.  It appears there has been
back and forth traffic since mid January. He asks that we work with his IT company, and
call him with any questions.  Please see his concerns below:
 
Thank you for your email Debbie,
Yesterday when I told you everything was okay, I was specifically referring to the hiccup that happened yesterday with ISP.
Everything seemed to recover, thank goodness, back to the status quo.
You should know that I have been complaining to our 3rd party IT company and to HIS that our Wifi is not performing the way it should and has become “status quo”.
This has been going on for months.
Please read through the email chain attached.
You guys give me a list of AP’s that are down (on your end), I investigate, send you my findings, and seemingly nothing happens.
3rd party IT company Edge, said last, that our Wifi system is old and just needs to be replaced.
Guests seem to be increasingly complaining about “Internet”, and I believe there are little things we can do to make it better.
For example, if AP’s are room specific, why don’t we fix the AP’s that are in the wrong room.
Other examples, no light on AP, no AP at all, etc.
Please see what you can do, working with our IT company.
Call me if you have any questions.
Thank you,
Andy
 
I have emailed back a response acknowledging him and told him we will address this and be in touch with him.
Can someone please help get this resolved?
 
Thank you,
 
 
signature_62940360
Debbie Dobbe • Customer Service Manager

From: Nichols Steven <stephen@hotelwifi.com>
Date: Friday, January 21, 2022 at 2:23 PM
To: Heide Werthamer <hwerthamer@edgecommunications.com>, Hotel Internet Services NOC <support@hotelwifi.com>
Cc: Andy Davidson <adavidson@markerkeywest.com>, Michael St-Laurent <mstlaurent@highgate.com>
Subject: [EXTERNAL MESSAGE] - RE: The Marker Key West | Wi-Fi Issues
 
Hello Heide,
 
I’m looping in my support team to assist with troubleshooting the current issues.   Let me give you a bit of background of the wireless network & HIS.  We took over this property in June of 2016 with a Fusion Gateway & network support, at the time the hotel requested to keep the Aruba wireless network which was installed in 2014 by another vendor. Initially the network was fine, however in the last couple of years there have been some issues with the guest Wi-Fi as the network equipment is EOL and the technology is now outdated.  Last August we submitted a proposal to upgrade the network with new Ruckus in room APs ( see the attached)   The current network is over 8 years old.  We can continue to tweak and try and fix the issues that keep occurring, however the best solution at this time would be upgrading the network to the most current hardware available in the market space.  Let me know if you want us to revise the attached quote with updated information.
 
 
 
Thank you,
Stephen Nichols
Hotelwifi.com
727.474.9899
 
 
 
From: Heide Werthamer <hwerthamer@edgecommunications.com> 
Sent: Friday, January 21, 2022 1:56 PM
To: Stephen Nichols <stephen@hotelwifi.com>
Cc: Andy Davidson <adavidson@markerkeywest.com>; Michael St-Laurent <mstlaurent@highgate.com>
Subject: The Marker Key West | Wi-Fi Issues
 
PLS NOTE: This email originated from outside of HIS.

Hello, Stephen:
 
I hope that all is well.  I am writing to you in hopes that you will help me with some special attention in Key West at the Marker.  Below you will see a recap from Andy Davidson (copied here) on continuous issues with wi-fi.
 
I would like to have a proper point of contact since going through support, although fine when issues come up, doesn't work when they are repetitive and/or prolonged.  We really need to dig deep to see where we can assist the property.  
 
My initial thoughts would be:
 
1.  Is there a recent wi-fi heat map of the property?  Both passive and active?
Do you have a set of -asbuilts?
How often do you do maintenance on your equipment with firmware updates?
 
I know that you will most likely refer us to someone else...just wanted you to be aware that this is going on.
 
I look forward to your anticipated quick response.
 
All the best...
 
Heide

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Andy Davidson <adavidson@markerkeywest.com>
Date: Thu, Jan 20, 2022 at 4:38 PM
Subject: RE: [EXTERNAL MESSAGE] - Re: Ticket Number 750536 WiFi Issues - Update
To: Heide Werthamer <hwerthamer@edgecommunications.com>
Cc: Yunior Rodriguez <yrodriguez@markerkeywest.com>, Genevieve Summers <gsummers@edgecommunications.com>, Van Owens <vowens@edgecommunications.com>, Ernest J. Romo <eromo@markerkeywest.com>
 

Heide,
I can recap.
·         The guests who stay at our hotel are complaining more and more about “Internet”.

·         This guest Internet dissatisfaction has been noticeably higher over the last 2 months approximately.

·         The WiFi provider, HIS, has recently (in the last 2 months) given me a list of all access points (AP’s) that show problems on their end (about 8% of the AP’s).

·         We have not been able to mine for details as to what “Internet” problems guest are having – this is not an easy task.

·         We have not been able to correlate problematic AP’s with complaining guests – this is possible only sometimes as guest reviews don’t always have room number, nor do we know where on property they had the problem.

·         So far, I don’t see any correlations or patterns to complaints, such as all coming from one section, etc.

·         I have assessed 7 of the 8 problematic AP’s

·         I find issues with the 7 problematic AP’s, like: missing AP altogether, AP’s not numbered for the room, no green light.

·         I find good download speeds (ds) and good upload speeds (us) using SPEEDTEST in those same 7 rooms.

·         During this same time period, we have had Internet connectivity issues with laptops and phones that did not seem to happen before roughly 2 months ago.

·         I personally have noticed the WiFi trying to bounce between our 2 networks.  HIS told me to just forget one of them, which I did, and that mostly worked – it didn’t used to happen before.

My specific AP assessment details are below.
I’ve been DOE here for almost 3 years and really was our only “IT” person for over a year while we had no local rep like Van.
Yes, I worked with Centrada, but many times they weren’t able to respond quickly enough.
While I’m not an IT person, I have historical IT experience at this hotel, Southernmost and other businesses.
For example, I signed Broadwave on about two years ago as provider for Internet and some phone lines – we used Comcast before.
Under Broadwave as the ISP, we haven’t had WiFi complaints in the last year as much as recently.
 
Please let me know if you have any further questions.
I’m available almost anytime Tuesday thru Saturday, 8a-4:30p, unless we have breakdowns.
Tuesdays are usually not the best.
Tomorrow is fine after 9:30a EDT.
Thank you,
 
image
Andy Davidson Director of Engineering
The Marker Key West Harbor Resort | 200 William Street Key West, FL 33040
T 305 916 8079
adavidson@markerkeywest.com
themarkerkeywest.com

image
 
 
 
 
 
 
From: Heide Werthamer [mailto:hwerthamer@edgecommunications.com]

Subject: Ticket Number 750536 WiFi Issues - Update
 
Good Afternoon Heide,
I know we closed the ticket out for WiFi issues, but I believe we still have unsolved problems.
We are starting to see a growing number of guests complaining about “Internet”.
Granted, we do not have much detail to chase down root causes, however, HIS has supplied me with a list of problematic AP’s.
This is what they can see on their end, and you can see below the results of my investigation on hotel site.
We should at least fix what we know to be a problem.
I sent the below information in last week.
It was suggested I send it directly to you.
Please let me know what the next step would be.
Thank you,
Andy

From: Andy Davidson 
Sent: Wednesday, January 12, 2022 3:25 PM
To: ITservicedesk (Edge) <ITservicedesk@edgecommunications.com>
Cc: Yunior Rodriguez <yrodriguez@markerkeywest.com>; vowens@edgecommunications.com; Ernest J. Romo <eromo@markerkeywest.com>
Subject: Ticket Number 750536 WiFi Issues - Update
 
Good Afternoon,
I’m following up your weekly meeting with an update to ticket number 750536.
HIS recently supplied me with a list of guest rooms where they can see issues on their end.
They asked me to check the access points (APs).
I was just able to check 4 of 8 today, and here’s what I found:
·         122 – Number BD122, green light, ds=47.8/us=44.9

·         130 – No number, green light, ds=41.7/us=47.6

·         135 – Number BD134 (so, wrong number), green light, ds=47.9/us=47.1

·         141 – Number BD141 (again, wrong number), no light, ds=46.5/us=47.7

·         145 – unavailable today

·         146 – unavailable today

·         202 – unavailable today

·         234 – unavailable today

I’m seeing (what I consider) good speeds in the 4 rooms I checked.
However, the AP’s are either the wrong number or no number and one with no green light (no light at all).
I have heard that these APs are programmed to be in certain rooms.
If so, maybe we need to do some re-programming.
We do not always have information on guest complaints telling us exactly what the issue was.
Sometimes they just grade the “Internet” low.
I don’t have information on which rooms were complaining and if they coincide with the list I was given by HIS.
Thank you,
 
image
Andy Davidson Director of Engineering
The Marker Key West Harbor Resort | 200 William Street Key West, FL 33040
T 305 916 8079
adavidson@markerkeywest.com
themarkerkeywest.com

Details:

"The 30 Ruckus APs on VLAN10are for the panic buttons for the staff managed by RFT, The IP phones and HP switches are managed by Allbridge."

I was able to ping the the Fusion and CLI into it and ping the rest of the network. Walter was able to get the Fusion back up. The Fusion went down for just less than an hour. After that I was informed be Briana (GM) that they had been having issues with guests logging in since 3 in the afternoon. I restarted the PMS interface which seems to have fixed that issue. We will be scheduling a tech to go out and update the firmware on the Fusion.

Good afternoon Mark,
As we discussed today we have limited access to the network right now in order to monitor the devices and let you know when the equipment has gone offline. This is because of some changes that were made by another party to the IP addresses, credentials and or VLANs that has limited our ability to monitor and access the network.
One of the services that you pay us for is to alert you when equipment has gone offline, and our ability to do that right now is limited. If you would like for us to fully deliver this service to you we can send out one of our technicians to redocument the network and get us access to everything, but there would be a charge for this. Another alternative is you could restore our access to the 172.16.0.x subnet on the switches throughout the property. My guess is that there is a VLAN tag missing somewhere for VLAN 101 on one of the switches that we don't have access to.  For your reference I have attached our "as built" documentation when the network was initially installed.  Here are the devices that we are currently able to monitor for your reference:

Walter Isbell

Summary: Good Time Hotel IPMI-MDF-B-01-1 IPMI is DOWN
Details:
Opsgenie Alert#8cf2c33c-26c4-4d5e-b88f-eb13320f78a3-1610572160829
Alert Priority: P3
Alert created at 2021-01-13 01:09:20
First note added on 2021-01-13 14:14:18 - 

2021-01-13 14:14:18 - AT&T Outage
Major Incident with Backbone at Ft Lauderdale
No ETR
Notified POC
2021-01-13 14:40:25 - Alert Closed.

A field nation tech went to the property to get 4 down access points back up. He was able to get 1206 & 1221 back online. The 2 remaining are 815 and 1416. 815 had a DND on the door so he was unable to get into the room. The port on the switch was verified as working. 1416 has a cable issue between the patch panel and the room. He tried using just 2 pairs on pins 1,2,3 & 6 as well and it still did not come up. He did not have a cable tester with him so was unable to determine the good pairs. the AP that was in 1206 is missing so we replaced it with the one from 1416 since the cable for 1416 was bad and we cldn't get it up at this time. They will need to buy a new AP and when it arrives we can schedule a tech to go out and finish the cable testing for the room and have a look at 815.

Looks like the fusion was accidentally unplugged after having manager reboot fusion and modem. Found out that they have a fiber converter box right above their fiber box. After rebooting the fiber box when the fiber went out got the hotel back up.

Here is a conference port mapping if anyone needs to set up a wired port in the ballroom.

Ballroom D21 --> Core Switch port f5/5
Talked to Neil and he wanted the portal page off and told me to check back next month when all the service upgrades go through for portal activation.

Fred Chang (cabling vendor) went to the property and re ran the cable for this WAN.  The previous cable was damaged and ran along the floor.
The new cable run goes Arris modem LAN port 2 -> MDF patch panel 2 port 13 ->PBX patch panel 1 port 6 -> HP j9086A (172.16.0.11) port 18 -> HP j9086A (172.16.0.11) port 20 ->Fusion  igb3.

Summary: ISP Issue Node 2 and Cluster Controller
Details: I recived a 4 guest calls in a row the guest were unable to get online. I started to look into this. I could not ping the Cluster controller and Node 2. When i could it would be 3000+ ms. I called the ISP and couple minuetes after talking to him the both gateways came back up and pings were back to normal

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details:
Hi Darrin,

I wasn’t on this email chain, so I’m not sure if you’ve been given a full answer to your email yet. Cary was able to urgently arrange a Galaxy tech for this morning, and I am working with him right now to get our integration completed with them this morning and activate billing on the guest network. 

Below is the data I have on how this all transpired. As I’ve not been involved in all conversations, I can only give you the broad strokes:

-          Service with Sunray was cancelled on the 21st, which unfortunately included Sunray turning off authentication and billing.
-          I found out about this on the 26th, and after conversations between Cary, Thomas and I, Cary scheduled Galaxy immediately and I believe Galaxy got involved on the 27th.
-          The data was not available on the 27th as to where we were supposed to connect into the admin network to communicate with Galaxy so the integration was not able to be completed at that time.
-          We received the port information on the 28th, and Thomas assisted on the evening of the 28th to make some changes on the admin switch to allow communication from our server to Galaxy.
-          As mentioned above, I’m working with Galaxy to get this completed this morning. Aside from the integration, we have everything ready – the portal page is fully built, the billing plans are loaded in our system, and we moved all of the WiFi, including the remnants of the old system, off the Nomadix to our gateway. So as soon as the integration is complete, we can go live with billing.

Best,

Trevor Dowswell
Hotel Internet Services
www.hotelwifi.com
T: 866-265-7575 ext.723
F: 805-578-5934

emailed t list of down access points


Room 0605
Room 0825
Room 0913
Room 1118
Room 1223
Room 2201
Room 2235

Summary: Network Diagram and Equipment list updated
Details: Following a recent site visit I did at MTS, I found that the Network Diagram and Equip. List was way out of date. I updated the network diagram to add the DSLAMs and also corrected the VLANs which have changed drastically. I also went through the VLAN Tabs of the switch GUIs, switch by switch, and updated the Wi-Fi Equipment list VLANs and port labels. I found that there are some key ports such as the uplink from MDFC switch to MDFA (Core) and other missing labels. These are marked with a "?" mark.
I called the property to check on a down switch but their IVR says they are closed due to COVID 19 since March 22 until further notice.
Closing Ticket with file uploads

.107

APs were installed in the stairwell as perscribed in the Scope of Work. Prior to installation, the panic button service operated by the hotel would only seem to work in the B or C stairwell. When button was pressed, the response time for the alert would be about 10 sec or less. In stairwells, D or A, the system would not respond when beeper was pressed at the stairs. After installation, response time were less then 10 sec in every location tested up and down each stairwell.

They panic system does seem to need some calibration as the reciever would only show the closetest room and not the stairwell.
Ticket Created: New property

Guy was able to get the switch back up in Cottage-E by replacing the patch cable from the poe injector to the switch. Also i was able to get the switch in Cottage-F back up by rebooting the ubiquiti in Cottage-F

Summary: CS call to Trey Pomroy, Dir of IT. There is an issue on recent update outages and lack of customer support. I wrote it up to Raf & Steve and acknowledged Trey.
Details:
Hi Trey,

I want to thank you for speaking with me this afternoon. I really appreciate you 
taking the time to tell me what has happened over the past several days, and for
including specifics so that I can get it into the right hands and we can make the 
necessary corrections. 

I sincerely apologize for the entire mishap and have already sent a full write-up to 
both Raf and to Steve, the COO, so that it can be properly addressed. You will be
hearing from us.  I have also sent an email to Stephen Nichols requesting that he
get you a copy of your contract. 

I will be following up with you to ensure your requests have been met and things
have improved overall. Meanwhile, please do keep my contact information and do 
not hesitate to call me if you need anything. I’m here to help.

Thanks again for your time.

Sincerely,



 
Debbie Dobbe • Customer Service Manager
Hotel Internet Services & BeyondTV
 
818-435-2702x765

 
866-284-4911

 
debbie@hotelwifi.com

 
www.hotelwifi.com

 
www.beyondtv.com
I worked with Mario at the hotel. We found that the UPS had no power. He plugged switch directly into wall outlet and switch came back on line.

Currently we are awaiting the hotel Oscar to get ahold of the 3rd party vendor who owns the equipment to figure out why it is not connecting to the SSID. Apparently there is a password to gain access to settings on this device.
I configured ports 10 through 14 on the switch with an IP address of 10.60.30.38 to pass untagged traffic into VLAN 120. This was in response to an email sent my Natalie McNeese.

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details: Mr. Larry Go, from Park Central San Francisco called us last night to make sure internet will be working fine today. He's with yahoo and they will be having a leadership conference today in the hotel, there will be 200 guest that will check-in to participate on the said event.
I emailed Seud and Operations to check on SW-IDF-N-4-01. All the connecting AP's are down and look to be down due to this switch being offline.

Summary: WLAN and VLAN for AC Module
Details: I created a WLAN with an SSID of "figueroa_ac" so staff members can access an AC unit. VLAN 44 was created for this. The AC module is connected to port 15 on the switch with an IP address of 172.16.0.50. The AC module has an IP address of 192.168.1.101. Clients connecting to VLAN 44 will be assigned IP addresses between 192.168.1.110 and 192.168.1.114.

Got an e-mail from Brandon that the TTI Kiosks were not able to print.  Found that the biz center computers were on one subnet and the printers were on another subnet.  On 10/30/14 Trevor implemented a subnet filter which caused these devices to no longer be able to communicate.
I instructed Brandon and TTI to return the biz center devices to the static IP addresses that they were assigned so that they would all be on the same subnet.  Once they did this all devices were able to print.

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details:
AP in 828: Looks like it might have gotten damaged from a water leak in the ceiling of the room, but its not clear what happened to it. AP was sent for RMA.
Business Center: The AP is still there but the space is no longer used as a business center but instead, now used as a staff members office. The AP wasnt working because the patch cable from the switch to the APs patch panel port had been moved (probably by the AV guys).

Gloria form Centrada called us and informed that staff or guests are not able to get the spalsh page but it is directly getting on to the internet. Back in august I turned the portal page off unusual way from Policies --> Captive Portal --> Guest pre login. I put the guest pre login to splash page. Called Ashley FD and she informed guests were able to see spalsh page but they are using access codes. Tried logining with the guests name and room but didn't go. I tried on my side but the same result. I called Gloria and told her to restart the HTNG interface she did two interfaces but the result is still the same. She will be researching more on this and will be calling the property directly. There is also a CAS ticket associated with it 7794425

Summary: Ticket Created: Nomadix was replaced with a Fusion please update Nagios
Details: Ticket Created: Nomadix was replaced with a Fusion please update Nagios
Checking with Walter on this.

Jenny Thorne emailed in a request to have an SSID and hardline connections configured for a Liberty Mutual event occurring on November 13th 2018. Guest will be using a VPN connection over the wifi and 2 printers with static IP's connected over hardline. SSID name: Liberty_Media with WPA2 key: liberty1234 .  I reused the Conference Vlan 321 that we had configured for previous events. Gave Jenny the IP addresses 192.168.212.8 and 9 with subnet 255.255.255.0 and GW 192.168.212.1. The printers should be connecting to the switch on the 3rd Floor switch IP: 10.60.30.14. Several of the ports are already untagged with vlan 321. We need to work with Jenny on insure the correct ports are assigned Vlan 321. I also noticed that the AP for the Salon was currently down, and requested to have someone investigate and either plug the AP back in or find out if the AP was replaced. The guests will be using between 80 and 125 Mbps bandwidth. I configured it for 150 to help insure the speeds are close to what they needed. I also informed Jenny that we will need the MAC address of the device they want to use a VPN with so we could assign a NAT to it, and that their IT need to allow for a NAT to work over their VPN. I have yet to hand out a public IP address for this.

APs fluctuated up and down  about 50 to 80. different areas, no switch down. The APs was up in the switch, but no LLDP. We discovered the SZ doesn't showed up client connection, but  in the Fusion it has ARP on VLAN 201 Guest Wifi. Sounds like the SZ got messed up in the brain, and needed to be rebooted. After wehn the 20 minutes boot up completed, we needed to reboot the APs by itself in the switch. 4 APs remained offline, but there was no linking port on the switch. Probably cable issue. PS: The SZ has been rebooted 2 times, because when the 500 APs trying to connect to it, it exceeding the threshold on the CPU and got frozen. Need to disable VLAN 101 the uplink ports on the core switch and have them back one by one. That the SZ not being overloaded. It will be fine.

The Fusion detected that another device was using the IP address 10.40.228.1. The Fusion is also using this IP address. When I checked the Fusion's ARP table for this device using it's MAC address, I found that it was using the IP address  10.90.228.1. This IP address should not cause any issues. The device causing an IP conflict was plugged into port 43 of the core switch. I sent an email to  Manny Gonzalez. I asked him if the device was using the IP address 10.40.228.1.
RCN ISP outage, affected the whole NYC area. This is back up now though. Down time was about an hour.

Summary: Offline PMS Interface Connection Restored - Royalton Park Avenue
Details:
Good evening,
We lost our connection to the PMS server at this location earlier today which caused problems for guests trying to login to the wifi.  This problem was caused by a device that was added to the network by some other party, which was using the same IP address as our Fusion Gateway.  To resolve this we changed the IP address that our Fusion Gateway was using.  Once we did this our link to the PMS server was restored, and we once again started to receive guest reservation information.  Guests should now be able to successfully login and get online.
Michael, here are some details about the problem so that this situation can hopefully be avoided in the future.  If you would like me to change our IP back to what it was originally once the device added today has been identified then let me know and I will do that.
IP address that we were using to communicate to the Opera PMS server - 10.0.9.35
IP address that we are now using to communicate to the PMS server - 10.0.9.36
IP:port  of Opera server - 10.0.10.7:5018
MAC address of the host that was added to the network today that caused an IP conflict, and is now using the IP address that we used to be using - 00:17:61:11:fa:8d

Regards,
Walter Isbell
Director of Network Operations
Hotel Internet Services
t: 866.265.7575 ext. 742
