Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Summary: Some users connected to AP-FL03-Franciscan-I not pulling a valid IP
Details:
We received a report from PSAV that users in the Franciscan meeting floor on the 3rd floor were having trouble getting online when connecting to the ParkCentral_Meeting SSID (VLAN 30).  In looking at  AP 2c:c5:d3:09:cf:30 quite a few of the users connected to it either had an invalid IP address, or were not pulling an IP address at all.
I checked the config on the switch that this AP plugs into and it was configured correctly, some users were getting online in the correct VLAN.
I rebooted this AP and after doing so all users connected to this AP were pulling a valid IP.

Park Central Hotel New York – Guests were having issues logging in with their name and room number. Cesar was working on this earlier, and informed CAS to report any tickets that come up with this issue. The PMS interface had been restarted. I called the property around 7:30 and they said they were still having the problem. I restarted the PMS interface again, and called back a little later. FD reported no more calls from this issue, but it was getting late and most guests are already asleep. Informed FD we will check on this in the morning to see if the problem still persists.

Summary: Beyond TV set up for room 238
Details: Juan called in from the Hotel wanting help to register the 2 TVs for room 238. I didn't know how to handle so I let him know I'd check with the engineer who knows and get back to him. I checked with Zach and found what was needed and I left a message with Juan to call and give us the mac and serial numbers for the boxes or email it to us.

Service Ticket #483498 - Alohilani Resort - Intermittent Issues with Guest Wifi Connectivity HIS case #9848660

For your records, POC moved the connection to the ballroom switch to port D19 on the MDF switch.  Tested Alohilani Conference, Alohilani VIP, Highgate and Alohilani Guest SSIDs and all appear to be working.

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details: I did this on Friday but due to Nagios issues this week I haven't been able to go back and verify that all devices are reporting "up". That is the only thing left remaining on this assignment.

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details: Marcus called in needing ports B3 and B4 on switch 10.60.30.11 changed to vlan 55 with a 40/40 Mbps. I untagged the ports B3 and B4 and the vlan was already set to 40/40. He checked the connection and everything was working fine.
I updated the Fusion to 7.560 to correct excess memory utilization.  I also added a MAC group database purger.

Sally Mei Cheif-engineer sent us an email, their Wi-Fi was down for 30 minutes. She told me on the phone the Wi-Fi came back up on its own, no one rebooted anything. Tried to check SZ, it is up 95 days ago, Fusion is up like 2 months also. The only thing I saw the DHCP shared network "vlan201" is over 95% utilization (1941/2007 leases)", and 6 APs are down. but on different levels. Rebooted one AP in the lobby, because it was 92% airtime utilization, otherwise not much error I found.

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Summary: AP in 3606 was not showing in the SmartZone 100.
Details: I defaulted and upgraded room 3606's AP firmware to H500_104.0.0.0.1347.bl7. I also found the port (C16) that the AP was connected to did not have Vlan 11, the equipment vlan, set as untagged. Once that was corrected the AP appeared in the Smartzone 100 and is now online.

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details: Send Support quotes via mail and email to Christian, Accounting and GM.

Upgraded the ZD and all DSLAMs to the latest approved firmware.

Travis from a construction company was calling about their firewall no longer having internet access after the WAN issues were resolved at the property. I found out that this was because the Fusion was connected directly into the WAN and that the setup Travis was calling about required the Fusion and the WAN connection to be connected into the core switch. I had someone at the property connect the Fusion into port 7 on the core switch, He connected the cable coming from the ISP into port 8 on the core switch. Both of these ports are untagged with VLAN 2. The firewall Travis mentioned was connected to switchport 20 on the switch with an IP address of 10.60.30.35. I called Travis and left a voicemail. I asked if the issue was resolved.
Could not access the ruckus ap's. i ssh into the ZD and enabled HTTPS on the ap's. I now can access the AP's

Summary: WiFi and WiFi Support - Hyatt Centric
Details:
Hi Roger, We provide the WiFi and WiFi support services at your hotel.  I’m writing to check with you and see how everything is going in those areas.
I also wanted to invite you to come by our booth at the upcoming Las Vegas Highgate Show if you are in the area. Hope all is going well and I look forward to hearing from you!

Summary: New Core Switch install and cleanup
Details:
I installed the new Core Switch sent to us from HP. (The original Core Switch had port failures most likely due to a massive power failure in downtown SF in Jul this year). 
I mounted the new Core Switch, pucnhed down 7 messy looking cables in the patch panel below it, and organized the rest of the cables plugged into the Core Switch. New photos were uploaded to CRM Docs.
I have emailed Robb about the changes, but he wasn't specific enough. I'm waiting for a response from him to clarify exactly what part he wants removed.

Ethan Fishbane - Front office Director emailed us saying guests cannot login using room number and last name. I have noticed there are no recent logins using room number and last name. FD infromed that they are giving out an access code for the guests to login. Raven - Centrada spoke with him and told him to restart teh HTNG server as they always reboot. I restarted the PMS interface on our side. He will be doing it and verifies with FD if they can login using room number and last name.

Hi Kevin,

I called today and talked briefly with the front desk. We handle the WIFI system & support services for the hotel and I just wanted to check in and see how things are going with your support services. She said things are good at the moment. Overall, is everything working to your satisfaction?

Hi Tyler! Hope things are going well for you all there at Hotel Caza. I wanted to check in to see how things are going with your Wifi and Wifi Support. Do you need anything from us to better service your guests Wifi needs?

Noticed e0:55:3d:84:30:60  was using IP 10.40.228.1 on vlan 40. MAC address foung to be Cisco Meraki device and found this was on vlan 90. Vlan 90 is for PMS. So, I had to chnag VLAN 40 subnet to 10.40.228.101 from 10.40.228.1. By doing this there was no IP conflict.

Guests were seeing a fatal 500 error that were connecting through Node 2.  I tried to access it remotely and was seeing the same thing.  Upon launching an ssh connection to the Fusion and running TFR I noticed the following in the log:

2016/01/22 15:45:16 rxgd[16509] INFO> main::handle_exception - database error persisted for more than 60s - alerting

Guest in room 306 having speed issues when he's in his room. Goes down to almost nothing inside room but out in hallway gets 24 mbps download. I checked APs in 305 & 307 as they are closest to him. I opened the port 3/4 on the core switch and untagged it for vlan 1200 so that the IT staff could install a new server that they purchased that had to be hardwired. 

Hi Patrick,

We’re trying to replace the FourWinds server at the Park Central NYC. I found out that it’s currently on WiFi, but on the Highgate network on a dedicated VLAN. I was informed it’s on the “HOTSOS VLAN”. It’s current IP is 10.60.31.23

The new server we purchased doesn’t have a wireless NIC.  We’ll need to hard wire the new server.  I assume this will require reconfiguring 1 port on a switch for this VLAN. Can you let me know the costs for this or if you need any additional info?

Thanks,

Bruce Williamson

Summary: New Switch Installed to replace "MDF PoE Switch"
Details:
A new switch was installed by Bill Sims and Juan today to replace the LG Ericsson switch that has been going up and down (10.60.31.11).  Previously when this switch was going offline was it was causing all devices connected to it, and most of the APs on the network go go offline.
When the new Brocade switch was connected a similar problem occurred.  Juan found that the problem was coming from a device connected to port 4 of the switch which showed up on lldp as "mezz_phones" which is likely short for mezzanine phones.  This switch is a Procurve J9089A.  Bill Sims reported that this switch did not have link on any of its ports except for the port that was connected to the .11 switch so we decided to unplug it since it was causing network problems.  As soon as this switch is unplugged the problem with all the APs going offline goes away.
There are now extra ports available in the MDF since this new switch is a 48 port switch.  The previous switch was only 24 ports and there was only 1 open port in the MDF.
Added the newest version of the already_logged_in view. This resolved the issue. I attached a photo for reference.
ISP is working on the hotels equipment and was was planned for.

I noticed the fusion was only doing 10megs on the upload. I looked and found that the Bandwidth Queues shaping was set to group. i changed it to devices. Once i did that the upload went over 10 megs

Summary: Staff Call - Alohilani Resort Waikiki Beach
Details:
Opsgenie Alert#35fce5ca-5303-4518-a88c-745f631ea33c-1611969005703
Alert Priority: P2
Alert created at 2021-01-29 05:10:05
First note added on 2021-01-29 17:33:12 - 

2021-01-29 17:33:12 - i worked on this case earlier. Justin
2021-02-02 17:00:09 - Alert Closed.

Called the hotel about the 3rd floor switch being down. The fd said they will send someone. It turns out someone had unplugged the switch. (because it's in the maids closet) plugged it back in and all of the ap's are back up

There were PMS issues that were reported by CAS. The Fusion could ping but not connect to the PMS server. I restarted the PMS interface on the Fusion. I sent an email to ghenriquez@bostonhelpdesk.com and help@bostonhelpdesk.com. I asked George Henriquez to restart the admin end of the PMS interface.
two APs (RM 2017 and RM 2010) had the same IP address - .194. I changed 2010 to be .195 to resolve the conflict

Nothing is changed on the controller side. 
172.30.16.5 is the IP address that was given to Sebastian to use. Port 26 is configured on 172.16.1.10. Changed the network address from /24 to /23 and also modified the DHCP pool as per his request.

There were support emails about a device attached to port 18 of the core switch. It was assigned an IP address of 12.161.61.165 but I was informed that it was not able to connect to the internet. I checked the configuration on the core switch. I found that port 18 was down. I let them know and the device was plugged in. Port 18 came up. I checked for VLAN issues on the core switch. I found that the modem using the corresponding public IP subnet was on port 6 of the core switch. This port was untagged for VLAN 2 but port 18 was untagged for VLAN 300. I configured port 18 to be untagged on VLAN 2. I checked the configuration on the Fusion and it looked like the public IP address was not set up. I also found that this address was being used by a device manufactured by ADTRAN INC. I configured the public IP address 12.161.61.169 to be available for use.
NOTE: If equipment needs to be rebooted locally, etc., call the Front Desk and ask to be dispatched to Engineering.

Front Desk person says the Wifi is fine.  He didn't recognize the name we have for their GM.  Emailed Al Valdes in IT

7/7/19 5 pm Pacific
The system went down with Fatal 500 Error in the Web Server.

**** What to communicate to the hotel ****
We have replaced the faulty hard drive in the system

9 pm. After investigating this we have discovered that the hard drive was full. We contacted RGNets and worked with them on this issue. Darrian cleaned the Development logs from the Fusion which freed up the space. After poking around Darrian concluded that there were missing files from the OS and the hard drive is most likely failing.

Instead of rebooting it one more time, which I think might of solved the problem (but we will never know at this point time), I started re-installing the OS via IPMI. This took all night. It failed several times and in the process I have update the IPMI version on the Fusion. The upload speeds were between 200Kbps and 5 Mbps.

7 am A tech from Field Nation (Bobby Hoang) arrived at the property. Bobby was able to help me load the OS on the Fusion. We have tried multiple times with automatic backup recovery from a flash drive and it failed.

11 am At this point we concluded that we needed a new hard drive and Bobby went to get one from Best Buy. While Bobby was doing that, I have tried to install OS one more time, but this time without having backup attached on a stick to the Fusion. The OS loaded and got to the licensing stage.

12 pm Bobby came back and we have installed the new drive. When he was installing the new drive, he installed it in the place of the old drive, inside a caddy. Caddy is a passive device that plugs in between SATA cables and the drive itself. It's purpose is to support the drive in place. Bobby removed the caddy and the system recognized the new (samsung) drive right away. At that point we have decided to put the original hard drive in place and test. The drive worked just fine

1 pm The system was restored to its working state. Portal page was tested with Bobby using a shared credential. 

1 pm Ceasar the Manager at the hotel called me from Bobbie's phone and thanked me and asked me to give Bobby a promotion for good work done.

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details:
AP in 828: Looks like it might have gotten damaged from a water leak in the ceiling of the room, but its not clear what happened to it. AP was sent for RMA.
Business Center: The AP is still there but the space is no longer used as a business center but instead, now used as a staff members office. The AP wasnt working because the patch cable from the switch to the APs patch panel port had been moved (probably by the AV guys).
The ZoneDirectors firmware was upgraded from 9.8.1 to 9.10.0.0.218.  This was done so that meshing could be used on the r500s.  The r500 requires firmware 9.10 or newer to mesh.

Summary: Guest Traffic Balanced Accross 2 Fusion NICs
Details:
I separated the guest traffic by putting 15 vlans onto one NIC and 15 vlans onto another NIC on the Fusion.  All of the guest traffic being on 1 NIC was causing the NIC to reach its interrupt load maximum.
Putting the traffic on 2 NICs should help to prevent this.
I have turned the page back on for now because RGnets needs information about a guest experiencing the problem in real time.

Both links were showing down. I called the property and spoke to Juan Vargas. I asked him to power cycle the fusion, and he agreed. 
After he power cycled the fusion, both wan1 and wan2 began responding to pings. 
Both WAN 1 and WAN 2 went offline again, Mr Vargas mentioned to me that the server room is very warm. He mentioned it shouldn't be. I agreed. 
After another reboot the fusion began responding to pings.

I upgraded the firmware on Manhattan at Times Square Switch POE on 17th Floor 2 to version W.15.14.0016. I upgrades the firmware on Manhattan at Times Square Switch POE on 17th Floor 1 to version WB.16.07.0002.

Stanford Court's new portal that I made last week wasn't displaying any plans. The reason for this is because the single complimentary plan configured on the Fusion was valid for 1 month - which exceeded the length of any of the guest's stays. This is an RGNets thing in the newer (mid 7s, like 7.3-5 and up), if a plan exceeds a guest's length of stay, it won't display the plan. To side-step this, we hardcoded the complimentary plan onto the portal. I forgot to turn the page on - Corey noticed it was off today and asked me about it. Turned it on.
Closing Ticket with file uploads
I've created the portal and am ready to implement it. I emailed Christian Cooper and am awaiting confirmation that it's ok to make the transition.

Details:
I removed VLAN 10 from the fusion, and from a few of the HP switches at this site, as some switches have reached the maximum number of VLANs (40).
Sunray Mgmt - VLAN 10 was created 05/28/2015 02:36 PM and was not in use at the time of writing this note.

Hi Vikram,

I called today and left a message for you. Sorry I missed you! We handle the WIFI system & support services for the hotel and I just wanted to check in and see how things are going with your support services. Is everything working to your satisfaction?

Any feedback would be great or if you can let us know if there is something I can help with. I have copied Casey as well in case she has something to input.

Just for an interesting read, we recently did a full survey of guests and hoteliers that is chalk full of good bits of information. Here is the link for that - https://www.hotelwifi.com/gre-survey-wp/

Looking forward to hearing back from you.

Best,
Shelly

Summary: Michelangelo Hotel NY: customer service call & FU email
Details: Called for Marco Gianni today and he is out until 3/14/22.   I asked for an alternative contact and was given Hamadi Sissoko, Operations Manager.  His email is hsissoko@michelangelohotel.com.  I left him a VM and a FU email.  Entered his contact data into CRM.

IT called from property saying their HDTV system has not been working this month. Said his Cisco switch is plugged into the Core Switch on Port 45, with a MAC of 50:1c:bf:d1:1c:d5. Checked Core Switch. No registering any connection on Port 45. Able to find the MAC when doing "show mac". Able to find this mac address, and it says its on Port 45. IT guy checking to see if the switch is unplugged for some reason. Will call back if needing further assistance.
Closing Ticket with file uploads
Michael St Laurent wanted us to change the domain from tajboston.hotelwifi.com to thenewburyboston.hotelwifi.com. Updated the same in EasyDNS and Fusion

Walter found a error in the fusion here today about a broadcast storm which caused the first WAN to go down and when the ISP emailed us back it was causing their systems to go 100% cpu when handling the connection so the ISP disabled the interface. We are setting up a RGNETS ticket to take a look at it and figure out what is going on.
Closing Ticket with file uploads

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details: I did a site visit last Thursday to check the AP's in 3624, 2825, and 2505. In 3624 and 2825, I found that the patch cables to the AP's behind the beds had been intentionally cut. See the photo of the cut cables attached. The Engineer said that some guests will do anything to get a free room. I replaced the AP in 2505.

Fusion went down today for about an hour and a half from 9:00am to 10:30am.  I believe it went down because of a change that James Lee (on site IT) made on the network related to a Micros server but I'm not sure.  Was never able to get good info from him on it.
I had him power cycle the Fusion and after he did the guest network came back up.
Ticket Created: Sonifi Form Complettion
Emailed Guy about the switch in Sound-Booth-2-01 thats down

Mike at Ruskus asked me to turn off the 2.4G radio in AP131 and AP173 as a test to see if it stops the rebooting issue. Ruckus engineers have duplicated the reboot problem in their labs but have not isolated the reason. They did find out that turning off 2.4G radio but not the 5G stopped the rebooting.

Christian turned on the Fusion this morning. Guests are getting on fine. I called the ISP to have them check to see if their Cisco Router was getting the broadcast storm again, no sign that it is. CPU at 15%. No errors. NOC going to keep an eye on it.

Summary: CS call to Brian Esquivel, Asst. Dir of the Front Office. Happy with both WIFI & GC, but had a report of infrequent outages. Sent to Support.
Details:
Aloha Brian!
 
Thanks so much for speaking with me today. It was a pleasure to
meet you!
 
I’m very happy to hear that overall things are running smoothly with
both your WIFI and GuestCast systems – that’s good news! I also
appreciate you letting me know about the infrequent outages that you
have been experiencing, most recently on July 8th. I have noted this
to our Support team, along with your note that the middle and higher
sites were most affected. They will be happy to look into this and you
will be hearing from someone shortly.
 
Meanwhile, please do not hesitate to call or email me if you need anything –
I’m here to help!
 
Mahalo,
 
 
Image

Hotel Internet Services

  source: "Guest Support request Form",
  title: ,
  rawData: "12/31/2021",
  phoneNumber: "9173734464",
  message: "URGENT

Hello,
We have an issue with one of the STB for the event space. 
It's plugged on SW-IDF-B-NB-2 172.16.0.31 and has the MAC ac:db:da:42:02:2a.
TV channels bring a black screen, but with the correct description of what's on that channel at that particular time.
Tried to call the support number but no one picks the call.
Please help with this issue as soonest possible.
Thank you.
",
  subscribe:

Spoke with Michael from Highgate and he said that the interface to HIS's router is not there. I asked for more information on this and when it will be back up so that we can test it, and haven't gotten a response yet.

From Robb Mengay: 
There are currently only 4 senders on the tower roof servicing the cottages.
Link 5 was the tennis ranch. That was removed from the roof about a month ago when we had the ping issued with the senders.
Last week, link 4, ip address 0.24 had its port go bad.  We copied the the config from link 4 to the link 5 device and that is currently live at 0.24

-No answer from the Hotel.
-Called Centrada (Monica). She transferred me to Ken the Onsite tech. He said he will check them out.

Summary: Park Central Hotel New York Switch in 11th Flr IDF 2 is Down
Details:
Opsgenie Alert#4e9614d2-a5aa-4c9d-a909-3616d9ac7d70-1590720631002
Alert Priority: P2
Alert created at 2020-05-28 07:50:31
First note added on 2020-05-28 19:55:03 - 

2020-05-28 19:55:03 - Switch recovered

--- 10.61.35.19 ping statistics ---
11 packets transmitted, 11 packets received, 0.0% packet loss
round-trip min/avg/max/stddev = 0.709/0.824/1.146/0.127 ms

- Eva
2020-05-28 20:21:08 - Alert Closed.

Called the FD multiple time to try to get someone to try and assist but they said no engineers. Called and left a voicemail for Nahun letting him know where I think the point of failure is - Between their Modular Fiber Core and the switch that provides the uplink to the 10.60.31.13. Still waiting to hear back but will call property again.

There was an issues where we could not access or ping any of the seubdevice on the network. At the same time the admin network was having issues. I spoke to Andy at the property and had him work with him on this. I had him go to the MDF and check what is connected to the core switch. He said there was something connected to port 23 on the core. i has him trace that and it went to the admin Cisco router. The minute i had him uplug that cable I was able to access and ping the subdevices. After that most if the ap's that were connected to the NC's were down. I had to telnet into ever NC and reboot them. once i did that all of the ap's came back online

I got a call from Steve, IT staff at the property. They needed to have internet access on one of their computers. This device was connected to port 16 on the Core Switch, MAC: 34:64:a9:31:15:58. I created a network on the Fusion with this settings: 
IP 192.168.1.1 
SN: 255.255.255.240

Their device is using Static IP settings and it's currently using 192.168.1.14. They confirmed that they are now able to access their service. They also request for a port forward to be created so they can access that device via http. I created the port forward and named it EMS Server http.

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details: I noted that over two days, ISP speedtest from the Fusion is giving over 800mbps download speeds. Also, looks like upload speed is limited to about 300mbps. I changed the Fusion to 700/350.

On 11/08/18, Tuned on Dynamic VLAN again and noticed that guests were able to connect to dynmaic vlan guest network. They are getting IP and radius server is assigning the guests to correct vlans but when we saw the traffic on the vlans and it was null. Tunred the tunelling off. We noticed traffic on the vlans. Looking into the traffic of Fusion LAN igb3 has more traffic when compared to Igb0 traffic. Igb3 is has all the vlan traffic that is trunked. Removed vlans 225 to 239 and removed vlan traffic 210 to 224 on igbo. Now the pings from ZD to coreswitch has few packetloss ie is 3%. But even though the traffic from igb3 is much higher than that of igbo. HotSOS1 ssid is connected to igb3 but even then packets from igb3 were 12K and packets from igb0 are 300 to 900 packets.

Summary: RE: Manhattan at Times Square Hotel - Daily Down AP Report
Details:
Hi Jonathan, how are You?

The APs what you are referring to, they was online recently. It is possible someone took it (stole it), or someone moved to different location in the room, or different room (technician), but those was online for sure. That is possible it moved to any of the closest room also.
So if you don't find an AP, try to go to the next room, or across to the hallway room. It might be there. To verify it when it is down, your only chance to have the MAC address on the back of the label. If it is match, that's id the AP what we looking for. If not, need search.

We usually have two places to place the APs. One is on the back of the desk, and another is in the soffit. It might hides there. See pic.

Please let me know, thank you!

Best,

Summary: Studio Alsten/TDC Owner 1234 LLC: customer service call
Details:
Called and spoke with Sean Marren at the Front Desk.  He says everything is running smoothly, no complaints.  I sent FU email to him at 
frontoffice@hotelstudioalsten.com  (see below).

Dear Sean,

Thank you for taking the time to talk to me this afternoon. I’m so glad
to hear you are happy with our system and support services.
 
I wanted to let you know this is how you can contact me if you need to
or have any issues with the service in the future.  Reach out anytime.
 
You can also reach your technical support contacts here, 866-265-7575, ext. 0.
 
I also wanted to let you know about our new product GuestCast, which has 
been getting a lot of interest.  After a survey of over 700 guests, we found that
65% of them wanted to cast their own content onto the TV.  Here is a link to the
information on our website in case you want to check it out:
https://vimeo.com/660731531

Thanks again for your time today.
 
Have a great week!
 
Best,

Summary: Park Central Hotel New York Switch in 11th Flr IDF 2 is Down
Details:
Opsgenie Alert#7933
Alert Priority: P2
Alert created at 2020-05-23 03:01:36
First note added on 2020-05-23 15:15:24 - 

2020-05-23 15:15:24 - Switch is online. Eva

--- 10.61.35.19 ping statistics ---
9 packets transmitted, 9 packets received, 0.0% packet loss
round-trip min/avg/max/stddev = 0.629/0.776/1.210/0.169 ms
2020-05-23 15:15:55 - Alert Closed.

The Fusion is running extremely slow, like there is something wrong with the hardware or software.  Menus periodically won't load, commands take multiple minutes to finish even in the CLI, and changes take multiple minutes to take affect.
I want to update them to the latest build to see if that helps, but their Fusion is showing expired support in the rgnets licensing portal.  The sales tab shows that they purchased Fusion support though so I'm checking with sales to see what the status of that sale is and why we havn't ordered the license yet.  Once I sort that out with sales I'll then schedule a Fusion update.

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details: The AP in room 2912 was not working. I found that the RJ45 connector on the rooms cable had two pins bent sideways. I replaced the jack and the AP came up. Not sure what could have bent the pins as the jack is behind the AP. Possibly was that way originally but was just barely making connection.

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details: On 31 Oct 19 the ISP Feed for Park central was down and neither the Chf Maint or the IT for the property knew where the source of the ISP Feed was located. What I found was that the Windstream's ISP Feed comes in on P-to-P dishes on the roof of Park Central. The Dishes go to a rack in the "Penthouse" on the roof where there is a rack. There is a Cisco switch with two Gig ports. The right hand ports is the ISP Feed which goes on Cat5e cable to the IDF on the 34th Floor. On the 34th floor the ISP Feed plugs into port 19 on blade F. The reason the ISP Feed was down was that the 34th IDF Switch was down due to being plugged into a failed UPS. I moved the 34th IDF Switch off the dead UPS an onto a separate power stripe. (See photos attached)

I configured port 43 on the switch with an IP address of 10.60.30.14 to pass uintagged traffic into VLAN 190. This VLAN uses the subnet 10.19.0.0/24. I used a policy that gave a maximum download rate of 30 Mbps as well as a maximum upload rate of 30 Mbps. Since the wired port was going to be used for video conferencing, I configured the bandwidth queue that I used to have a priority of 2.

Summary: Add vlan to switch port , enabled HTTPS on Ruckus AP's
Details:
I looked into why the 10th floor IDF Switch (192.168.56.100) was down. I found that 10th Floor IDF PoE port 47 was not tagged for vlan 101. i tagged that port and the switch came back up

I enabled HTTPS on the Ruckus Ap's

I called the hotel and spoke to an engineer to have him go and rebooted the 14 Floor IDF switch.
wan1 ISP outage was resolved at 10:35pm. I was able to log into both fusions on wan1

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details: Marcus emailed support requesting a new SSID for an even that is happening next week. The name of the SSID is MGS 2018  and WPA2 PW is dynalyst . I used the SSID Special Conf Wifi - 192.168.100.0/22 - VLAN 400 since it was not already in use. I assigned the 100/100 Mbps unlimited devices Policy to this as was requested. They will be testing this on Monday around 10 am.

I called  the ISP to look into the WAN 2 modem. The ISP agent said that there was nothing that she could see that is wrong with the modem. I had her see the packet loss going to the Fusion. She felt the issue was something on our side. I had her restart the modem and informed her that we will keep an eye on this and call back if need be. Ticket#04785674

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details:
I gave the IP address 64.79.116.235 to Jen Hering for a SIP device.

IP Address: 64.79.116.235
Subnet Mask: 255.255.255.240
Default Gateway: 64.79.116.225

Port B21 on the core switch was configured to pass untagged traffic into VLAN 187.

Summary: AP in Rm 1935 moved to Rm 1934
Details: The AP in room 1935 was moved to room 1934. The CPE in room 1934 is not currently connecting, The phone line in room 1934 needs to be tone traced to the MDF and then punched down to the DSLAM phone block (currently the DSLAM phone block port for room 1934 is connected to a port on the old VDSL system)
Talked to Chuck and he had some questions how to proceed the UPS replacement when the UPS will be arrive on site. They will call us back when it is there.

The Fusion’s WAN2 interface was dropping packets. I called the property. I spoke to someone from the housekeeping department. She said that she could help troubleshoot the issue. She asked me to call her on her mobile phone. She gave me the number (347) 831-1766. She could not find the WAN2 modem. She said that I should call her or the property tomorrow.

XO is going to check the equipment on their side and call me back if there is an issue. Ticket Number 3347413

I have already rebooted the Fusion there and still not getting anything from either ISP equipment.

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Summary: Routers Using Public IP Addresses not Connecting
Details: Three routers being used were able to reach each other but not the gateway. I found out that the port they were on was assigned to the wrong VLAN. I assigned this port to the corect VLAN, 187. This resolved the issue. The MAC addresses of the three routers are CC:16:7E:14:82:19, 70:6B:B9:02:98:14, and CC:5A:53:D1:FC:81. They were assigned the IP addresses 64.79.116.227, 64.79.116.228, and 64.79.116.229. All three devices were connected to port B4 on SW-IDF-2-01. They wanted to connect each router to a separate switchport. A staff member from the property moved some cables to get one router on B4, B5, and B6, I configured the two new ports to allow access to the modem via VLAN 187,

Someone had removed the port forwards that I created for Robb. Robb emailed in saying that he needed them put back in. He also wanted 172.16.2.2/10002 and 172.16.2.2/20002 added.

There were three APs that were showing as down in Nagios and in the ZD. One was the MDF AP. There is actually a working AP in the MDF and is shown as a second AP in ZD. Thats corrected now. The AP that was in the hallway outside 1510 was down. There is no AP outside 1510. There are APs outside 1509 and 1512 and both of these APs are working. I got this corrected in Nagios. Lastly, the 7982 in the Salon meeting room appears to have been replaced with a spare event 7372 AP. I verified the 7372 in the Salon and got this corrected in Nagios.

On 11/08/18, Henry from Centrada called us and he informed that guests are having trouble connecting to the internet. He connected to Nancy at the property she was not able join guest network. I tried logging in guest information in splash page but gave me error message that invalid room. Turned the portal page off and asked her to join the network but she was not able to. I saw that there are 100 and 100 client devices connected to lobby 1 and lobby 2 AP's. I created a network that is using the same vlan 210 as that of guest network without tunneling it and asked her to join the network. She was able to join the network and stay connected without the connection getting dropped.
AP 729 on the switch on the 7th floor was running at half duplex. I changed the automatic settings to 100Fulldx to so that the device would not continue to lose it's connection.

Summary: The Row NYC Gateway Cluster Controller is DOWN
Details:
Opsgenie Alert#216deaf7-9963-469e-abbc-3cb0cd3f3339-1593234008229
Alert Priority: P1
Alert created at 2020-06-26 10:00:08
First note added on 2020-06-27 04:57:03 - 

2020-06-27 04:57:03 - When there is a power outage in the MDF the cluster controller will not come back up automatically. The power button on the front of the Fusion has to be pressed to turn them on. In addition to this, a keyboard needs to be connected to the cluster controller, and F2 has to be pressed so that it will boot up. Rick Gomez has done this before and knows how to do it.

Sent email.

-Tanya
2020-06-29 15:04:11 - No UP notification from Nagios for some reason. looking into this. Billy
2020-06-29 15:04:16 - Alert Closed.

Summary: Moved Megapath WAN uplink to core switch
Details: Megapath uplink was not operational; I had a tech from megapath move it into the core switch with another cable running back to the Fusion. I was now able to ping the default gateway for the Fusion in that subnet (66.166.238.105) but not the Fusion (66.166.238.106). From the Fusion I could ping out to the gateway and to the internet. Megapath was not able to confirm if there was a firewall setting that was preventing remote access to the Fusion. They are escalating the issue to Level 2 and will contact us back with further details.

Summary: How are we doing? Park Central SF Hotel
Details:
Hi Michael,

I called today and left a message for you. Sorry I missed you! We handle the WIFI system & support services for the hotel and I just wanted to check in and see how things are going with your support services. Is everything working to your satisfaction?

Any feedback would be great or if you can let us know if there is something I can help with.
Just for an interesting read, we recently did a full survey of guests and hoteliers that is chalk full of good bits of information. Here is the link for that - https://www.hotelwifi.com/gre-survey-wp/

Looking forward to hearing back from you.

Best,
Stephanie

Summary: Ticket Created: Please updtae this property on Support and Monitoring
Details: Ticket Created: Please updtae this property on Support and Monitoring

Today I installed the 3rd Floor APs (8 total). The AP by room 318 did not come up because a bad cable. I have informed this to the IT Manager (Saurabh Katial <skatial@centrada.com>) so he can have the cable vendor fix it.
I also installed a temporally AP in the Rooftop outside bar and I told Saurabh that they needed to water proof the AP otherwise it would get damaged.
Port 23 on switch configured with VLAN 55(which was already created) for a device that needs no splash page. This device can provide mark the updates of temperature and room conditions.

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details: Closing Ticket with file uploads
Closing Ticket with file uploads
There was an outage due to the hurricane.

At the moment we went back on the property for checking AP-FrontDesk 172.16.38.105 was online.
Please let us know if you can proceed with the whole import.

Summary: APs Disabled in Nagios because of Rooms remodeling
Details:
Trey Pomroy told me we can disable the APs in Nagios because the rooms are being renovated.
Attached is the list of APs
We removed the WAPs form on the 4th floor 25 to 44 for renovations - all of the AP highlighter in green have been removed for renovations

c4:01:7c:0b:fe:e0	nyc-mts-apLobby2	AP-Lobby2 went offline on 2/8/17.  it is suspected that construction caused this AP to go offline.  The tech that we sent on site was not able to reach this AP, so he instead installed a spare AP close to the place where AP-Lobby2 was initially installed.
The spare AP that was installed has MAC address 38:ff:36:2b:6d:f0.  This AP was previously installed in room 641, but was removed because the phone equipment was removed from that room.
Closing Ticket with file uploads

I spoke to Lindsey today and she said that they have issues occasionally with the internet but nothing major that needs to be resolved and that overall we are quick to respond and handle things quickly so no upsets or problems with us. Friday, the 5th is her last day so she is sending me a new contact.

The portal page has been turned off.  The page was turned off at the request of Nathalie Uy because guests are receiving a message "Error Code 36" when trying to login with last name and room number.  This error indicates that there is no PMS server configured in the Fusion.  Since there is a PMS server configured in the Fusion I have opened a ticket with RGnets to resolve.

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Summary: Portal Page is turned back on
Details: Durga turned the portal page off of the property because guests couldn't log in to the Wi-Fi. Durga restarted the PMS on our side, but still had the issue.  Checked the PMS today morning and it was seems working. Called the property and worked with the front desk. He tried his phone after when the portal was back on and it went through on room number and last name.

I configured port 1 on the switch with an IP address of 172.16.0.15 to pass untagged traffic into the WAN1 VLAN. I found a public IP address that the vendor can use, 67.130.103.180. I created and configured VLAN 853 on all of the switches. I reconfigured the WLAN PureHD to use this new VLAN. I created a static route for Pure HD on the Fusion. I created a static DHCP lease on the Fusion for an interface used by Pure HD for the IP address 192.168.10.5. Port 2 on the switch with an IP address of 172.16.0.15 was configured to pass untagged traffic into the guest VLAN using the subnet 192.168.10.0/23. I added the Pure HD network 172.19.0.0/20 to a whitelist on the subnet filter applied to the "Standard Guests" and "Quarantine Passthroughs" policies. I added the MAC addresses 08:35:71:05:37:ee, 08:35:71:05:37:ef, and 08:35:71:05:37:f0 to a passthrough group.
Closing Ticket with file uploads

Summary: Ticket Created: Wi-Fi and Guestcast Installs Complete
Details: Ticket Created: Wi-Fi and Guestcast Installs Complete

Jose Vasquez contacted me this week to get Guest Match set up for guests who opt out of the Urban Fee. Guests with the Urban Fee (or facility fee as he called it) are assigned a "FACF" code in the Tax Type field of the hotel-side PMS interface. Otherwise, the field will have "NONE" or "EALL" applied to it. I asked him to contact FIAS and have them map the Tax Type field to the Custom7 field of the Fusion. After that has been done, I will set up the PMS Guest Matches and test.

Summary: Park Central San Francisco Hotel | Fusion Gateway is Down
Details:
Hi Michael,

I hope all is well.

We have noticed that the Fusion Gateway for the Wifi at Park Central San Francisco Hotel has been down for about 4 hours now. We have been trying to contact the hotel phone number at 415.974.6400, but we can't go through at all. It goes straight to a busy tone every time we dial the number. Please check and see that there is power to the equipment. Otherwise, a reboot of the Fusion box should restore it.

Feel free to contact us should you need further assistance. Have a great weekend!


Regards,

Eva Jaenar
Hotel Internet Services

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details: David Gordon called in about the support email he sent out the other day. I had him plug in his device. Switch 10.60.30.11 Port C1. I was able to see his device connected. He was getting an Ip address of 192.168.130.7. I gave his device a DHCP Fixed host and passed his device though. Once i did that he tested it and everything was working

Summary: Cloud 5 PBX Public IP Address Given

Details: This location was down today for about 2 hours. I attempted to reach the FD multiple times but was put on hold. Called the Engineer Sup for the property but he didn't pick up (was off, I found out later, thoug he does still work there.) Finally reached Norman Perez, engineering guy at the property, had him reboot the Fusion, this resolved the issue.
Looks like someone was setting up Dynamic VLANs for the IDF switches but stopped because they didn't have access to the House Switches (our switches go through the house switches).

Closing Ticket with file uploads

This switch was already pre-configured at the time of installations and its a brocade switch. This is currently a spare switch and can be used when any of the switches go bad.
IP address: 172.16.0.22.
I deactivated this switch in Nagios.

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details: Closing Ticket with file uploads

Hello,

I was showing that the Fusion was down so I called the ISP to make sure everything was good on their end. The ticket number is LT1697553 and they are going
to investigate the circuit at West House. I spoke with Anil and he informed me that the Fusion overheated,
since the AC to that room broke last night. He said that maintenance is working getting the AC back online.

I set up VLAN 250 for Cherry Blue production company to use. They said they needed a 1GB line and I let Jaesung Oh know that the hotel is not currently set up to be able to deliver that much to them. I set up the hardline port in room 537 on VLAN 250 with no bandwidth queue configured. Daniel from the hotel events unit ran a speed test and he was able to get 191mbps down and 230 up and was going to let the client know and see what they wanted to do with that. I have not heard anything from him since he tested it so I don't know if they ended up using the setup. The port that is set up for them is port 5 on switch SW-IDF10-6-02 10.60.30.25.
I spoke with Andres Vasques today to see if issue was resolved so we can turn page back on. He stated it was not resolved and to please leave page off.

Yesterday it look like there was a network loop created. All of the ap's were going up and down and the 28th floor switch was down. I worked with an engineer on this. At first i i had him reboot the switch but that did not do anything. I finally had him unplug all of the Ethernet cables except the uplink (port24 ) then had him plug the cables back one at a time. This was able to bring the network back up. He said there was a cable that was plugged into the switch on both ends.I just had him unplug the cable from the switch

A phone was added to port 5 of the switch with an IP address of 172.16.0.60. This port had an incorrect VLAN configuration. I corrected this by allowing traffic tagged with VLANs 300 and 1000 to pass into the port. I also configured this port to pass untagged traffic into VLAN 130.
Closing Ticket with file uploads
Hotel is closed until July 1st as per Security Keith.

About 20 min later got this message: "AC in MDF is not working, temp is at 96F. Engineering department is working to fix the problem. As soon as AC is fixed, will restart Fusion."

Maureen Albright - informed us that The rooms on 16th are all under construction.  The rooms on 3 are also under construction and devices have been removed.  
On January 7th we will be releasing the 14th and 15th floors to construction as well as all rooms ending in 16, 17, 18 and 19 (ie. 616, 717, 818, 919).

Company Name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Downtown SOMA
Details:
After making the below mentioned changes Pete Rosales called back in and said that users are still not able to get online.  I looked at the conference tool and found that 5 different conferences had been configured with the same SSID, which will not work.  
This resulted in a scenario where the same SSID was being broadcast multiple times by the AP, with each instance of that SSID putting users into a different VLAN.
I e-mailed Pete and let him know that each conference needs to have a unique SSID, and I advised him to make these changes.  I did not adjust the SSID's in the conference builder.

Summary: Switch and AP Being Stored For Future Use
Details: A switch and AP were sold in 2019 and shipped. The equipment was going to be installed in a retail space that has since been shut down and leased to another party (equipment not needed). Kevin Mello of "INTECH" will be storing the equipment in the server room for future use elsewhere. We are closing out the project at his request, but should assist with configuration later since he will have already paid for it.
